text: The melting pot of hawaii, in vegas! I love the different choices they have, Kim chee, saimin, musubi, adobo, lau lau. So many island favorites to choose from. I get the adobo fried rice omelette. Really good. Food was hot. Fresh and huge! Yumm!

We are visiting from L.A. for my son's basketball tournament, and after spending a few hours at our hotel, we were looking for places to eat. We decided to go to Aloha Kitchen on Decatur blvd. At this restaurant,  there was great service along with some great food!  Today we got a delicious spam musubi,  kalbi (ribs) combo with chicken katsu, and the Local plate.  All was very tasty.  The spam musubi was awesome, good quality spam, warm rice, and fresh seaweed.  One of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas!

Was craving for a late Hawaiian meal with my coworkers and ventured  across town to find aloha kitchen. I had ordered the loco moco and I must say, it's not the best thing I ever had. The hamburger steak was so dry and lack any kind of flavor, the gravy was ok.  Would I come back? Sure, the prices were decent and might be worth trying again if I get one of those late night Hawaiian food cravings.

Every time I come here there out of a item I like , the tables are sticky as if they wiped them down with a dirty towel , soda machine is usually out of ice, or the rice is crisp like it's been sitting for ever 

I'm a islander so it's hard to find island food that's open late  now I have do deal with this

On February 24, 2015, i had a horrible experience at this place. An employee of this restaurant mistreated a costumer. This costumer was an old woman. This happened around 7pm. I don't know the name of the employee but it looks like she is the manager. She is tall and I think she's Hawaiian. The employee was also saying bad words in front of costumers. I've been a costumer of this restaurant for more than 5 years and yes the service has always been terrible but is the first time that I see something like this happen. This was my last time eating at that restaurant!!

Food was lit definitely food network status! Had some adobo and rice omelet, pork adobo on the side and my wife got the Korean BBQ plate! This was a good experience definitely super cheap and convenient late at night dinner!Definitely stop by whenever I'm at Vegas!

Heard about this place on buzzfeed and was very excited for some good Hawaiian food. Was not disappointed!!! SO GOOD! Best Hawaiian food since I was in Hawaii. 

If you are visiting and have a rental car it is a mere 15/20 muns from the strip.

I got the kalua pork and cabbage and my husband got the fried rice lovers omelette with sausage.

Will be coming back here before we leave.
As good as its gonna get for mainland cookin Hawaiian food. Not gon complain cuz I get my kimchi and sticky rice, not like that minute rice they have at other joints. Smh.

Super crispy chicken wings portion that rocks !  I decided to order loco moco too and this was a great surprise. It just melts in the mouth. For a late night bite, this is a great place as the service is fast, the food is hot with topping of affordable prices. No matter of the late hour the staff members are friendly and are paying attention to every customer. Really impresses with this place.

Usually when I come here Cyndel always takes my order and when she does, she is super friendly and nice. She always welcomes us. It's always nice to see her and I give her a 5 star. The reason why I gave a 4 this time is because another worker took our order & wasn't that friendly. Her & another worker didn't greet us & they were busy chatting away.

The good:
1. Opens late
2. The rice

The bad:
1. A bit overpriced
2. Food was not that great. Too much sauce and too salty..

Me and my husband have been coming here for like four years now. & I can trully say I love everything I've tried.! My favorites plate is called Kalbi (ribs). It comes with like a sweet glaze you can pour over the ribs. of coarse I order extra macarroni salad! Why? Because it's delicious! The kalbi plate also comes with white rice and a small cabbage salad. I've also had the student special witch is teriyaki chicken on top of white rice. Yumm!
My husband also orders the loco moco one of his favorites after he has had a few drinks. & ofcoare we can't forget the spam masubi. He has to have one of those everytime we go.
I love how they remodel there Decatur location looks very nice & it's always clean! It has a very chill atmosphere. It's opened late and it's cheap. They also deliver & cater. They have a karaoke bar next door witch of the four years of us going there we have never been next door lol but everytime we are in the dinning area we can hear how the people at the bar are enyoing them selves.
There staff is very friendly (they know us now lol) I highly recomended when you are in the mood to eat something good not expensive and just chill.

I used to come here a lot and I remember it being decent, but my last visit wasn't so good. We came in about 2 hours before they closed and I got my usual, spam musubi, I've been in love with this treat since I was in middle school and I love when I get to have some in rare occasion since spam is not too good for you, but my treat was ruined that night... It seemed that I was given old already prepared ones because the edges of the rice parts were hard and crusty. Such a disappointment! I barely ever have this food and this one time I was craving it so bad and I wasn't given their best... Not even good. So aside from my food being a total waste of money, the place was clean and I love the layout of this place! My friends and I would come here some times. They have a door to the place next door, I think it's a bar... I like their drink selection too! I recommend the guava canned drink! It's so good! I had some good times here but I won't be back. I'm not happy I was given old crusty food.

Pretty good with the usual "local" food from the islands, but usually only during the day. Probably one of the better ones here in Las Vegas, during this time period. 

However, I went there a few times late evenings, and it seems like the quality suffers bit.

This is my first time visiting an Aloha Kitchen. My coworkers and I ordered several plates to go. There was a line when we arrived, but it went fast. I wanted to try the Local Plate. The macaroni had to be tossed because I found a small white rock in it. I contacted the manager Marla and I explained the issue to her. I was given her cell phone number, so I can text her several copies of the pictures. Marla mentioned that she'll show the pictures to the kitchen. Per the assistant manager, the issue will be taken care of. Thank you all for taking care of the issue quickly.

I've been coming to Aloha Kitchen every month or so for the past 8 years. However, my past two experiences with the service at this specific location have been less than mediocre at best. Today, I came in to pick up some manapua for my daughter as she has been feeling ill. When I got home they were so undercooked that they had caved in on themselves and the meat was oozing raw dough. When I called to see if they could replace it, I was placed on hold and then hung up on. I called two more times with the same result. It really is a shame. This place used to be so good.

4 words.  Adobo.  Fried.  Rice.  Omelet.  A legendary dish.  For those who don't know adobo, it's a Filipino dish that's main ingredients are soy sauce, vinegar, and onions, complimented by chicken or pork.  Not spicy, but really flavorful.  They have other Hawaiian dishes like loco moco, mac salad, kalbi, etc., too.  Bring your appetite.  This thing is about the size of a Chipotle burrito.  It is soooo delicious a friend came along after breakfast at the Bellagio buffet and still managed to finish it.

Huge portions, inexpensive, yummy.  I had manapua and fried saimin.  Manapua (sweet pork in a puffy thing) was good but a little sweet for me.  The fried saimin (noodles with pork and green onion and stuff) was so delicious I tried super hard to finish it but just couldn't.  My companions had some good stuff too -- pork adobo was good and portioned as if the whole pig was used; chicken katsu was light and tasty.  It was just a short cab ride from the strip (it's near the northern end of the strip, off sahara blvd).

Used to go here once a month or so. Then I was a victim of racism and I'll never go there again. The incident happen during the daytime (was busy, but not that busy). I ordered 2 entrees and waited for our food to come out. 20 min. later, I asked where's my food? They told me it was coming. I saw  6 Asians come in WAY AFTER I ordered and they got food in 4 minutes. No exaggeration. Once I saw that, I canceled my order and demanded a refund. Don't go there if you aren't Asian!
Best Hawaiian food in town. Love the hamburger steak and the loco moco with the sunny side up eggs on top! Excellent service!
We had our Christmas party there last night, what a great time.  Good food, good drinks and the dj was so much fun...Thank you to Aloha Kitchen what a wonderful time
My go to place after school. The service is quick and the food is great. Also open late.
Best Kalbi I've ever had! Mac salad was to my liking as well, as in, not drenched in mayo. Nice staff and not too long of a wait time for take-out.

The teriyaki chicken is smothered with too much teriyaki sauce and its soupy. next time I ordered I had the sauce on the side but the chicken itself taste burnt and rubbery. I also had their kalbi but its bony not enough meat for me to really enjoy, the flavor though is good. My husband like the garlic chicken but it taste burnt to me. The rice is too mushy but their serving is good. The only thing I enjoy here is their spam musubi. They have great customer service but I wouldnt come often unless I dont have a choice

One of the best Hawaiian foods in town. I definitely recommend trying this spot out. The staff is very friendly and I introduced a lot of people to this spot and everyone always had good remarks. The local plate is very full filling and great

My Roomie Nicki G. was out & about for lunch on Valentines day, looking for a new Hawaiian BBQ place, since the one closest to us had changed their menu to all Chinese. 

Needless to say, I had looked to the Yelpeeps for some answers & started searching & reading countless reviews. So, I mentioned this place to her & showed her the menu. It all looked pretty good & some of the reviews seemed very promising. Unfortunately, that is as far as it went. She brought back a Kalbi combo for me, which included Chicken Katsu & Teri Chicken. 

I was super hungry & I was looking forward to digging in. However, I have to say I wasn't very impressed with the portions, especially the mac salad, which was in like really small cup. Not to mention the fact that is kind of had an odd taste to it, kind of like the way a Dentist's office smells. To me, this plate seemed like a mini plate & not like a regular. The 2 scoops of rice equaled about the size of 1 scoop you would find in a regular. 

As far as taste goes, it was mediocre at best. Not very flavorful as far as the marinade went. The Kalbi was a little on the small side, as well as the Katsu & Teri Chicken. I didn't end up eating all of the Katsu, it just didn't seem like it was prepared very well. I don't know, maybe got spoiled living in Hawaii & just have high expectations. 

Overall, based on this experience, I don't think I would return or even recommend this place. If anyone cares to compare, take a look at my L&L review & look at those pics of my plate lunch in comparison the pics I am posting for this review. 

Just a side note: To me, mac salad is kind of like salsa. It is a very simple thing to make & even make it taste pretty good. However, a lot of places find some way to mess it up. I have been to many a good Mexican restaurant, but somehow the salsa is always bad. I don't know though, what can do? :P

Love aloha kitchen and my coworkers and I come here once a week for karaoke. Most of the djs are great they will look up what you need and want to sing but there is one guy who kills our vibe every time the African dj doesn't make our time enjoyable he seems to not like his job much and everytime he completely ruins our night I hear he's there Thur, Fri, sat beware you have been warned

I've heard a lot of things about this place. The good and the bad, but all I seemed to get when I finally decided to give it a shot is the ugly. There was a long line with two working registers, but only one person working both. It was pretty sketchy because one register was only excepting cash and the other one only credit cards. It caused such an inconvenience and their system was very inconsistent. They had one other person behind the counter expediting and running out the orders. I ordered the local plate and the ahi poke. My friend had the kalbi and lumpia. This is the culmination of my very disappointing lunch: carbs doused is sugar with a side of protein. Everything was just so sweet. I am all about the balance between sweet and salty but damn what a shame! It was all too sweet for my liking. AND the poke! FROZEN in the center! It was just big cubes of frozen fish. Tuna is a beautiful protein and should never be frozen, any seafood in that matter. When I told them about it, they sent it to the kitchen and when it got back to me the plate was warm. They popped fish that was meant to be served fresh in the microwave. WHAT A SHAME! My friend's kalbi was too sweet as well. Good char but too much sugar. The lumpia was mediocre. I didn't care much for it. Also, the place was very dirty. It looked so unorganized and dusty behind the counter.

Will I ever come back? That's a definite NO.

Would I ever recommend it? HELL NO.

My husband and I ordered 2 aloha plates with double katsu each in addition to multiple sides for pick up. After picking it up 20 minutes after placing the call, rather then getting fresh food, all was soggy, lumpia was soggy and cold and the forgot to give us katsu sauce. I called and spoke to Sally the manager, in which all she said sorry and who the name was on the receipt. It was Mariane. Not looking for anything free, just looking for fresh good food  which did not happen, and there was no try on guest recovery.  Not worth the $25 bucks, and definitely had a fast food management mentality. Too bad.

I wanted to support the Hawaiian places here but I don't think I can.  Sorry bruddahs.  Went in for late lunch.  I ordered the teri-beef.  It was dry and overcooked with some teri-sauce drizzled over it.  It didn't even look appetizing but I was starving so I ate it.  So 2 1/2 stars for the food.  My gf ordered the lau-lau.  It was so-so.  Probably frozen and imported in from CA or HI.  Oh, and to top it off, they shut off the AC on an extremely hot day.  It was almost unbearable to be inside.  Hello?  This is Vegas.

Love this place! One of my coworkers suggested this for lunch one afternoon and I'm so glad I went! I ordered the chicken curry and it was so delicious. We ate in and the food came super fast and it was hot and delicious. Highly recommend!
Ordered the oxtail soup.  Took a long time to get our order.  Oxtail was mostly fat.  Maybe I need to order something else next time.

The food's good, but their customer service wasn't up to par. When I walked in, this guy at the front didn't even greet me nor look up. Idk what he was doing, but with his head down, he said, "I'll be right with you." Then the woman at the front who took my order had a bit of an attitude and made snarky remarks whenever I had a question about the menu. Idk their names, but the guy was Hispanic and a little short. And the woman had a Hawaiian accent and wore glasses. I'll probably only be back for the food, and not their customer service.
How I wish there was one in NY! Damn their food is good =) has a warm home feeling, adobo omelet is the business while my girl friend will tell you to get the pulled pork! You can't lose!!! =)

Our go to place for local grinds.. Very friendly atmosphere. Large portions and hella good.

The husband and kids favorite is the Kalbi ribs plate. 

My fave is adobo fried rice and the fried saimin. Tasty

We always come here every time we're in LV.  My kids love the adobo fried rice/omellete and my husband always gets the oxtail soup.  Staff is very nice, plenty of parking and they close late (5am).  Highly recommended.

Came here with family during a week trip to Vegas.  I just went there last week and I'm normally up for whole in the wall places so long as their food is good.  But this place I didn't really find anything worth remembering.  I ordered the loco moco.  It didn't have much taste and I tried to give away my food to the rest of the family.  A few of us ordered the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet which I tasted and thought was not really worth coming back to.  Unfortunately I will not be back.  I think the only saving grace is the price is somewhat reasonable. I do really like the Hawaiian restaurant they have at the Cal much better.

This place disgraces Hawaiian local food. The sauces are wrong, the musubis are soggy, and just blah. As soon as you walk in it looks like the tacky waikiki "grass shacks" that we dont even have here( i live right near waikiki). Huge disappointment when i heard there was "hawaiian" food i was expecting better. I dont know why its so popular with the people living in vegas. the food just sucks. There are local hawaiian food places scattered around vegas MUCH MUCH MUCH better than this place, because you can tell that the owners and workers are actually FROM Hawaii and know what the hell they're doing.
Love this place! Great food and service. Affordable menu items. We highly recommend the place.
Great place to eat! The staff is great! You need to try the adobo fried rice omelet! Highly recommended!

Great and exciting hip place to meet to have some little bite or dine in, nice ambiance , friendly atmosphere.. I have been going at this place for years and great place to hold company parties and other occassions.

So unprofessional. Lady that I've never seen there before was talking about her personal business like she was at home. She was venting about something to the others. Her face was ticked off. Keep your personal issues at home and serve your customers!

The food is not bad, love the musubi and the local plate. maybe the sauce is a little sweet for me, but still okay. only thing I'm giving this place a 3/5 is because it took them almost 35 minutes to get my food ready.
The worst place to ever order on the phone! They don't make it until you get there. What's the point of ordering in advance?

Love the mahi mahi n adobo rice!!
Resto looks good n clean
Staff (Carol, Paolo) were amazing !

Great place to have weekly family meals
I've never had any kind of islander food but this was amazing. Fast and very tasty. Most defiantly coming back.

This was my first visit. After viewing the menu board I noticed SO MANY local favorites and didnt know where to start so I ordered the pork adobo plate with mac salad. I thought it was decent because my preference is to have it a little drier/crispier rather than a lot of sauce - though it was tasty. The BBQ plate my friend ordered looked pretty good too!

I would recommend this place because Im sure there are some delicious winners on the menu - I just didnt hit it on my first visit. Again, lots of local choices on the menu, very impressed! 

Finally, this must be a good place because there was a small wedding dinner reception in the main dining area while we were there! Awesome and congrats!

If you are looking to sing karaoke, have a few drinks, eat some loco moco afterwards...you've come to the right place! The DJ was awesome and the service was great! I have to say my favorite dish here is the loco moco and the spam musubi, you can't go wrong with that. Wednesday night is ladies night and ladies get 1 free drink per hour!

Had a party bus take us straight to this place from our hotel, yep, that's right,..a party bus. Awesome people working there! Had great food and they had a Filipino street food service when we got there! Great place to grab some comfort food!
Karaoke every night!!!  I love to sing!  Yay!! The foods not bad either. Go see one of the great bartenders and ask for the shot special!  Mmmmmmm good:)  Definitely makes me sound better:)

I came here with a friend at 1am after we tried going to 777 at Main Street Station which was closed for the night.  So, this was next on the list of places to get loco moco after a night of drinking.  The place is tucked away in a shopping center and is conveniently located next to a karaoke bar in case you're in the mood for some singing to go with your food.  I would have to say that the loco moco here was good but not impressive.  My friend ordered egg with spam which looked pretty good and he confirmed that it was.  Maybe next time, I'll try eggs with spam.

Always have been a fan of Aloha Kitchen.

My go-to meal is the chicken katsu with rice and macaroni salad.
I've had the loco moco which is delicious.
You can't go wrong with spam musubi either. They've got a great selection of Hawaiian and Filipino dishes on their menu.

Great tasting food, and the staff is always great to us. I highly recommend this location.

I visited Aloha Kitchen for the first time yesterday. This was a place that my co-workers ordered from a lot since it's in close distance from our workplace.  I ordered the chicken teriyaki and a side order of spam musubi. I enjoyed both but my only gripe is that the chicken teriyaki didn't come with vegetables. I don't know, maybe I always expected any chicken teriyaki plate to be mixed with vegetables?  Either way, it was still good. Would I try it again? Sure. There was some other things on the menu that caught my interest.
nothing beats the terri beef, except of course manapuas and musubis to go along with it, good food and friendly service equals great times

It's a beautiful day, the weather finally cooled down with a slight breeze in the air..the clouds rolled in giving that just right temperature..
and I couldn't think of a better place to go eat! Aloha Kitchen ~ this place was perfect! I had the Loco Moco Plate with an extra egg...done 
"Over Easy! " It's a must! oh and a lil soy sauce~to give it that extra mmm! 

The hamburger patty over rice with gravy and the eggs on top! MMMMMmmm! It was fulfilling! It  topped off the day..with the weather outside~how comforting! ...just went hand in hand! 

Like having hot coco on a cold winter day.....

Good food but horrible service! The fat lady is very rude to the guest! Like she made my experience horrible I rather go l&l.... I asked for a halo halo she said hell noooo! Like what kind of service is to say that to a guest! Like damn what is her problem? Rude as hell!!!!!!!! She wears glasses she thinks she all that!
Their kalua pig, chicken katsu, mixed veggies, and spam masubi is awesome!!! Your total can be pricey but it's worth it.

i enjoyed their chicken teriyaki bowl and went back for it again. The chicken was cooked fresh which is why the wait takes a little while for your food. It's also a good portion for $3.50ish. I was disappointed with the manaupas because the bread was hard and did not taste fresh at all. I thought because I came late that's why so i tried again at 12 pm thinking they made it fresh in the beginning of the day, but I was wrong so I wouldn't recommend those.
Favorite  spot to eat when I'm in town.  Adobo fried omelette is what I always order, but there are many other items that are delicious.  And the prices are just right.

Coming to Las Vegas, word of mouth for Polynesian partiers, this place was highly recommended. Arriving at midnight, the bartender was terrible and showed frustration, unable to keep up with clientele. Pricey for a bar off the strip, and the atmosphere of "gangland" was definitely in the air. Foods from next door, was ok. However the customer service was terrible. The show of fatigue and frustration was evident via the employees, which made it very uncomfortable. All in all, what everyone hyped up about this place is so off, better with a cooler in the parking and ordering food to go.
Good food. Found a hair in my food , and they didn't do anything about it.  Disappointed but the chicken katsu, bbq chicken and beef was good; but they didn't do anything about the hair in my food.
Amazing Pork Adobo!..Loved the live music :)

One of my favorite places to go for food. Service is always good, and the Chasu Pork Fried Rice Lover's Omelette, which is super worth for 7.69! Cyndel behind the counter always remembers my name, even though weeks pass. Definitely recommend whenever possible!

I've eaten here twice now and love the food. The spam musubi and lumpias are great. Their poke isn't the best I've had but still decent and would order it when coming back but i wish it was available at all their locations.

My only problem is bringing the kids here. While they love the burgers, they wont eat the teriyaki chicken because of the fat and the skin.
Aloha Kitchen is a nice little restaurant. I love the concept of it. The food is alright for what it's worth and for being in the mainland. The karaoke bar is cute. And the staff is always friendly.
Adobo rice was just ok. No haupia and cash only gives this place three stars. Spam musubi was decent tho.

Whether we were looking for a place to eat after school, or coming from a night of underage hooligans, Aloha always welcomed us with open leis. The adobo fried rice omelet with chicken is fantastic, but my personal favorite is the five dollar student special for the chicken teriyaki bowl (AND drink). You brought me in with the price, you kept me with the taste. I love a good chicken teriyaki bowl and Aloha has it. Everything is always hot and the chicken has a good flavor, and I personally think the hot sauce on the table adds just the right amount of flavor for anyone. Don't worry Aloha, I will be back.

The food is not the issue here at all.  However, in the Bar/Karaoke area there is a security guard named Ron (Ronnie).  He is by far the rudest, most unprofessional person I have come in contact with in years, and he covers in the absence of mgt.  Because of him, we will not be returning.  We have held several gatherings this year alone and until he is sent back to school to further his education in manners, customer service and management skills we will not be returning.  We have always had a great time there and have been coming for over 6 years, but this guy has made it unbearable.  I hope management sees this and makes some adjustment, because we wont be returning till there has been a change with him.

I used to love this place. I got take out nearly every week for about a year. But tonight I went in with friends and it may have been the last time. The lady with her bun on too tight who is always behind the counter has always been very short with me. I look the other way because it's decent food, convenient to my home, and open late. But this time Ms. Tight Bun took it too far. She was rude about answering my friends' questions about the menu while we were ordering. Snapped at us twice and never did answer our question about what was in the soup. There were 4 people at the table and they brought 3 meals out. We waited. Then my friend said what he was eating was not what he ordered. He took the plate up to the counter and I asked him to ask about mine too because my food hadn't come. She told my friend he was eating my food and she would get his. The food he had that he had already started eating wasn't what I ordered either. So I took it back up to the counter. She argued with me about what I ordered, slammed the plate down, and said "you'll just have to wait." It was an average night. She wasn't especially busy but it took 30 minutes to get our food we were snapped at while we ordered and then it was wrong and got to deal with her attitude. I really like this place normally but tonight two out of four people left hungry and angry. I'm afraid I won't be able to go back without checking to see how tight her bun is on that day. I feel like I should open the door and toss some Midol in at her to see if it's safe to enter. Wow! You can't treat customers much worse. Take a vacation lady. Come back a happy person please!

It's been over 2 years since I last ate this kind of food. I was so excited to finally eat at this place after being in Vegas for 7 days. I ordered the teriyaki meal, special combo and an order of lumpias. The food smelled so good, it reminded me of A & A's in Samoa. When I tore into the plates, I was so disappointed. The teriyaki had a very weak flavor almost bland. I could have done without the chicken and Kim chee which was jarred from any grocery store. Such a huge let down after craving this food for so long.

The Aloha Kitchen we went to was on South Decatur Boulevard. They have another location on South Maryland Parkway that caters to the locals and UNLV students alike and I hear they have another one on Lamb Boulevard. Rumor also has it that these three locations are somehow affiliated with the Aloha Specialties store that we all know and love, located in the Cal in downtown, but that has been unconfirmed. Decorated with an almost over-the-top, stereotypical Hawaiiana theme (grass roofing, bamboo poles, brightly painted seating), the restaurant at least gave a certain sense of warmth and Hawaii feel.

But nevah mine all of that. Let's get to the food! I wasn't all too hungry myself, since I had landed not more than a few hours prior, so I ended up just going for the burger and fries combo. I wasn't expecting much because I'm not much of a burger eater to begin with. Well, to my surprise, the cooks at Aloha Kitchen did good with this one. Really good. In fact, I would even go out on the limb and say that this was one of the best burgers I've ever had in my life. And believe me, I'm getting up there... this life is not a short one anymore.  There was just something about this burger that made it ohhhh so tasty. The saltiness, the butteriness, the sesame-seed bunliness... YUM! If you go to Aloha Kitchen, you just gotta try this one.

Read my complete column (with photos) here:
http://www.world-wide-ed.com/2006/04/01/vegas-kine-grindz/

This place was somehow strange to me. You order at the counter, sit down at one of their nice dining tables and then they hand off your food to you. Meanwhile, there's a fast-food beverage dispenser for your sodas, waters, and tea in the corner. The LCD displays for the menu is cool.

It's like, "hey Anh, we like you and all but we're like a Roberto's that you get stuff yourself, but hey we'll deliver your food right to your table. Don't expect us to see you again to check on you." It's funny to me. It's a clean fast food restaurant, but with a "pick up your food and GTFO or here, please sit down in these nice chairs." Think Teriyaki Madness but it's small-business owned.  

We ordered for two Loco mocos. What better way to cure a hangover by 3PM right? 
Loco moco missed the mark. Nothing to write home about. Like if I was in Vegas and you lived in San Diego as my facebook friend, I wouldn't be all, "DUDE. You have to try out this loco moco." Super plain. Not very well-seasoned. As soon as my knife sliced into it, the yolk was hard (barely runny at all). I want to see that over-easy egg's guts all over my rice. I felt cheated! Hamburger patty was too tough, which made it chewy than it should be. Not quite flavorful. 

I left feeling dissatisfied. Not hungry, just sad. Maybe I just wanted the rich heart-attack-inducing feel of a loco moco. The mac salad it came with was alright.

I like how clean this place is. Really nice tables and chairs. I like the separate water dispenser from the soda machine. A nice take-out place sort of feel. Prices were about right for what it was.

I don't really see what all the hype is about, but I think it deserves another chance.

We eat at Aloha Kitchen all the time, being from Hawaii its nice to get local foods.  There food is Very good and the portion size is amazing. This year we decided to Cater from here.  We were offered a tasting so we could try a variety of things that we may never have tried.  Everything was amazing, In fact it was so awesome that we are going to have them cater our New Years Party. We highly recommend this restaurant. Good Food and Wonderful service.  Aloha spirit from the moment you walk in.
My boyfriend and I only ever order carry out from here.  We are late night eaters so we love that this place is open late at night and the food is always consistent.
This place sucks ass took them one Hour to realize   They had mess up my order.  was not busy at all never ever goin again
Yummy laulau, easy service and good food. Great place to hang out. They still have the "student special" of rice, chicken teriyaki and a soda for $5

I used to love this place back in 04 days.. Now It's just.. I don't know what exactly happened.. The portion of the food seemed smaller (maybe the recession?). The food is still good ofcourse it's just amount of food that we got and the service. It wasn't the same as before. Me and my bf came in around 1am, because I just had gotten off work and I wanted to get some food before i went home.. When went in the restaurant we felt the vibe that we were not welcome.. and when the person served our food.. the guy started cleaning all the tables and making us and other people seem like intruders in the restaurant.. so me and my bf had to chow down everything in like 10 mins. The guy decide to lock the doors and it wasn't even 2 yet... I just don't understand the hours here.. 

If you want business.. then treat customers with priority.. Don't make them feel as if they need to hurry the eff up so you can get your asses home even if the store hours says that you should still be open anyway.. I mean i would come back but for the service.. I would rather try a different location or just stay with L&L..  better service and with good quality food.

I used to get take out and order my favorite  garlic chicken  all the time.  But for some reason the last few times I've been there the chicken tasted like it was old and dry.  Not fresh like how it used to be.  It's sad because now I won't  come back.  I might it one more time in the future  and hope that they will cook it with fresh chicken.

We threw a retirement party here for a good friend. It was an AMAZING night. The bartenders (Nate and Evan) and deejay, Mackly KILLED it!!! So friendly, personable and fun. I can't speak highly enough about Mackly, the deejay/karaoke host. I felt like we should have paid him (although he did accept tips, which we did.) He was on the mic all night, hosting dance contests and frequently congratulating our retiree friend...making him feel special. Extensive karaoke list. Cute little, lounging area with a good amount of places to sit. And our party-goers could go next door for some yummy Aloha Kitchen food. I highly recommend hosting a party here.

The Portugese sausage fried rice omelette was delicious!
I can't say enough good things about it so I won't say anything else at all and just let you yelpers try it for yourselves.  The lumpia was just so so.  Spam musubi is normal. Better than L&L but not by much.  When i was here I saw a homeless lady with her 3 kids walk in to use the bathroom and drink water that is provided out in the open for apparently anyone.  A little disturbing but it was 115 degrees outside and I don't want to see anybody die from the heat so I was like whatever.  If the owner or employees want to allow this that's there choice.

I come here every now and then as its not that close to where I live now. They have quite a selection and there's always something new to try. Food is great but my last visit service was disappointing that's why it's 4 stars.

Today I walked in and ordered for my wife and I. We waited 40 mins to get our order and the woman at the register said the reason why my order was taking so long was because 1 one of the items on our plates took longer to cook than the others. Finally when our food was ready that 1 item that took so long to cook was Cold ! The whole plate was cold! I was expecting steaming hot deliciousness instead I got pure disappointment! I just asked for a refund because I'm not waiting another 40 mins, for another plate, instead I'll go to L&L Hawaiian barbecue...

Friday 02/24. Came in after my son's baseball game at 9:15pm. Ordered a loco moco and a short stack of pancakes to go. Was not busy at all. After 30+ minutes of watching people come and go getting their food I had to request a refund. Totally unacceptable. You might as well jump on a flight to Honolulu and you'll have food sooner than waiting at this place.

I am so disappointed with this restaurant. Ordered the maja katsu and the fish had no salt whatsoever. The chicken katsu was overly cooked and was so dry. My son ordered saimin. It was salty. Everything we ate was either too salty or no salt. Never coming back to this place again! Too bad Yagyu Ramen close early otherwise we would have gone there for our katsu cravings...

Best night of karaoke ever. Crowd was great with many good singers. Mac, chocolate Thunder, is a super DJ - gets people up dancing, sings and super fun guy. Chris, the bartender, besides making great drinks, is an entertainer himself. You will not lead disappointed!!!!!
Good Hawai'i style plate meal with Hawaiian, Filipino, Korean and American selections. The pork Adobe and pork adobo fried rice omelet was delicious, and the saimin is one of the best.

We came here for brunch. My first time here, and I ordered spam, eggs, and rice. It was delicious! However it took about 30 minutes for my order to come. If the wait wasn't so long, I would have given this place four stars.
Fabulous, the food is very delicious! The service is good, some of them are nicer than others but overall its consistent, affordable and quick!

Pros:
Introduced me to the wonders of Spam Musubi.
It's just generally a good place to eat. Not much more to say.

Cons:
.........there's not much more to say. :/

Still love it though. My favorite Hawaiian restaurant in all of Vegas.

What's the best thing to eat after having a crazy NYE in Vegas? This place. Seriously, the adobo fried rice hit the spot considering I had a mini hang over and was still in my clothes from the night before. 

It was a little hard to find, but once we found the place, we were golden. We came around 11 am and there were only a few people in there. It was probably because everyone was still sleeping! Haha. 

The staff is friendly and the decor is perfect for a Hawaiian place. And the food, the food is BOMB. I ordered the adobo friend rice omelet and my friend ordered the spam and eggs. We all loved what we ordered! The adobo fried rice omelet was so so good. The rice was a little crunchy like fried rice is supposed to be and the adobo had a little crunch to it too. Just like my Lola makes it. Except it was wrapped in an omelet! Instead of the egg being in the rice like normal adobo fried rice, it was wrapped in it. Genius! Haha.

Anyway, I would definitely come back to this place and order the omelet again. It was that good!

I go here once in a while and  when I do I always get the Kalbi Plate. Although I ordered it with the turon today thru the phone and when I got the yo pick it up, they told me that they don't have turon [yet].
Love kalbi ribs there. Add kimchi and you got a nice satisfying dish. I go there at least once a month and will go ahain.

Very good, so good you might just forget your stuck in Vegas and not the islands that this restaurant reminds you of. I always get the Teriyaki combo which has pork, chicken, and beef, and of course a big scoop of macaroni salad and two scoops of rice. A friend of mine which introduced me to the restaurant is from Honolulu and just loves the food also. 
When I first moved to Vegas me and a friend were looking for some karaoke and just stumbled on the bar portion. Which they are connected but if you weren't hungry you would not step into the restaurant side.
Anyway the atmosphere of just laid back fun is great, the karaoke is great fun and free, with a one drink minimum of course.

Some of the best things about this place
- Open Late
- Cheap
- Lots of decent eats
- Service is pretty quick
- Local Spots (won't get those damn obnoxious out-of-town peeps in this joint)

The adobo fried rice omelette is pretty damn tasty but I don't see why they just can't make that as an option for the "rice portion" on any other dish. I would so pay extra to add that my bento box, loco mock, or breakfast i-log dish. 

That's my only complaint about this place. Hopefully they'll heed my advice and add it as an option to their menu.
I love this place! Food is delicious and prices are reasonable. The staff is super nice and their Karaoke Bar is a fun place for locals!! :)

This is one of my favorite places around the end of the month when I'm close to broke. Good food and very affordable. Since the first time I came here I felt like home, it reminded me of my mother's cooking. No, shes not Hawaiian, but her secret  ingredient waaas?....SPAM! And one thousand possibilities. But I have tried other favorites like  Mahi mahi katsu combo, also the teriyaki chicken and they're as good as...well, spam. This place is always busy so the word is out.  If you're looking for some good affordable home tasting Hawaiian food. Aloha kitchen is the place!  
                        You don' say ham, say spam!
Ate here twice during vacation! The Loco Moco is one of the best! The Spam Musubi was perfect and at a good price! Definetly coming back!

The food is very good. I got take out, but  i was not happy when i checked the bank account the next day to see they had gone ahead and given themself a $7 tip. I didnt get his name he was the bigger hawaiian looked to be in his 20's working the evening shift.

This place has been around for years.... And I have been going for that many years!  BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD I've tasted here in Vegas.  Staff is SUPER FRIENDLY!!! As are All Hawaiians! Lol. But Loco Moco is AMAZING! Spam Eggs and Rice breakfast is yummy! Get lumpia.... Adobo fried rice omelette is amazing.... TRULY anything and everything you get you will love!!!

We went here for lunch since it was recommended by a friend who frequents Las Vegas. The place is small and not a good place for a large party. Service was HORRIBLE! The waitress didnt greet us when we walked it then after waiting 10 minutes after we sat down, she came up to us and asked us if we were ready to order.... SERIOUSLY?! We didnt even have a menu yet. GEEZ. The food was okay. my husband and I had the Kalua pig and Katsu combo and we regret it. The Kalua pig was way to salty and dry. My stepmom had the adobo and the pork was really dry too. I will not return here again, I'd rather got to L&L.

Hyped by a coworker as her favorite place for Hawaiian cuisine, I made a point to stop by and order some of the dishes she'd suggested. My experience didn't live up to what I'd expected, but it wasn't awful either.

Service was great, staff are friendly. Restaurant is clean. Didn't experience the bar.
Opted for the Local's Plate (beef and chicken teriyaki, two musubi, sides of rice and mac salad) plus a lumpia app. I'm not the hugest fan of teriyaki and this was not one I would necessarily come back for, spam on musubi was thinner and less flavorful than what I've had at L&L, I preferred the lumpia I've had at actual Filipino places, and I'm generally not a fan of mac salad in the first place because of my aversion to mayo.
The dishes weren't bad, they were just a little lacking in flavor and not the punch of flavor I'd expected. 

Would come back to try other dishes suggested: oxtail soup, adobo fried rice omelet, manapua, but I'm not in a hurry to do so.

One of our favorite spots to go to. Service is amazing and staff is really kind. I only get the Kali rib plate because it's too delicious. If you really like char on your meat, get the ribs well done! You won't be disappointed!
Recently tried the Kalbi Ribs and they were so good and they give you a lot.  Macadamia Pancakes were bomb too.

Would never easy here again.  Food is horrible.  The rice was microwaved.  What kind of retardant does this.  Who stores cooked rice in a fridge and warms it up in a microwave when some orders food?  And you can tell a lot of stuff was reheated and not cooked fresh to order.  The discoloration of chicken,  beef,  or pork is a dead give away.  

I use to love this place.  Food use to be great till about 2006 or 2007. Then it just horrible now.  Rather eat fast food over this place.

How can I give you good reviews, Aloha Kitchen, if you no let me in?! 

They don't open at 8 even though yelp and their doors state that. They open and close whenever they want. Here at 815 and they told me they'll probably open in an hour. She told me this WHILE posting a sign that said "closing at 2pm." 

From the check in tips, looks like an ongoing problem.

Boo.

boohoo cry cry.  I wanted .. I expected... well dunno but I didn't get it here.

We got the pork adobo because of Ed V.'s review, and the Hula plate because it sounded good.  Both were NOT good.  They ran out of the pork adobo, so they said try the new chicken adobo we have.  It was too salty and basically just tasted like chicken boiled in shoyu, dry, salty.  The rice was no good, the mac salad was warm, the Hula plate was all fried seafood bleh.  bleh.

I've been spoiled and tainted by Hawaii. I LOVE my Hawaiian food and this place was pretty good for the mainland. I have to say though, that I have yet to find a Hawaiian joint that taste like over there. I blame my family in Hawaii for their wonderful cooking and for bringing me to the best places ever when I visit. 

The spam musubi was okay, not great and not bad, just okay. I ordered the adobo fried rice omelette. It was huge! I ate maybe half of it and I have a big appetite. It was good, however the meat was a little dry. 

Service was great and I definitely would come back to try the other entrees.

I Love this place! I come here everytime I come back from Cali. The service here is always good. Food is Always good! Adobo fried rice omelettes ftw! I also love their Tapsilog, but they run out of that super fast! If you enjoy tapa as much as I do.. come early for this. I think they run out between 10:30am-11:30am.

I've been a loyal Aloha Kitchen customer for years. It's my favorite Hawaiian place ever since my college days UNLV days. It's cheap and really flavorful comfort food.

However, tonight's visit is another story...

I was enjoying my stir fry veggies with chicken plate, until I found a plastic object in my food.  I was 3/4th done with my meal, so I suppose there was no point in complaining about it. And it's an Asian (Filipino) establishment. I know I won't get much sympathy from the owners.. So instead here I am venting about it on yelp.

This is the first I've experienced something like this from Aloha kitchen..Sooo disappointing. If I do come back, I'll make sure to check my food ahead of time from now on for foreign objects.
When in Vegas gotta stop by this spot for adobo fried rice, open really late.

The staff is really friendly and the food comes out quick. I usually order my food to go, but the inside of the restaurant looks clean.

I usually get the BBQ mix plate with short ribs, chicken teriyaki, and chicken katsu. Pretty good, flavor is good and I like their mac salad. It's definitely a good late night spot.

Pretty decent Hawaiian eats, not too expensive and large portions. No problem parking. (It's in a strip mall at the southwest corner of Sahara and Decatur - had I known about it sooner when my younger brother used to live in the apartment complex next door I woulda hopped the fence in a minute!)
Adobo egg omelette hits the spot. Portion is large enough to share or make into smaller meals.  Id call in my order.  Pass the banana ketchup, please.

Going into this place always makes me think of the Hawaiian take-out joints back home. I haven't been back in a while, but I ordered some BBQ chicken to go today. 

Not that the place was tastefully decorated to begin with, however when I walked in there today, it looked even more run down than I remembered it. It looked like they had taken down things from their walls, many items on their menu were covered up with white paper, which I'm sorry, I think is very ghetto. Scotch taping a piece of white paper on the soda labels to show which one they are out of?! Generic white styrofoam cups? I don't know. Just looked like lots of little things, probably to cut costs.

The cashier was nice, my order came out timely, but I walked out of there thinking, "Am I going to come back here?" 

I thought that until I opened my order. BBQ chicken I remember I loved, tender, juicy, even the rice was still hot. My son, as we speak, is inhaling the leftovers. Their portions were always generous.

That's probably why I'm giving them 4 stars.

I've been coming to Aloha Kitchen for years, and personally this is my favorite Hawaiian spot. Over the years, they raised their prices and portion sizes, but they have still kept things relatively consistent. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal or experience here. I really like their combo plates, and I usually get the Local Plate or Aloha Plate. The bar area is nice, and they have karaoke and gaming. I highly recommend this place

I drive all the way from Summerlin to this location, (I even pass the other Hawaiian food place) just to get some of their extremely delicious Kalbi Ribs. I refer to them as my meat candy. They are so perfectly marinated in their homemade Kalbi sauce that has a home cooked taste to it. They even remember me by name when I call in my orders without even asking for it.

Contemporary interior looks nice.  I like the interior better than east one. I am very surprised at finding this good reviews in Yelp. We had Teriyaki ball, that tasted just like grocery store selling Teriyaki sauce, too sweet.  We were very sad to find out this was not for us.  I wish to try Kalbi comb, but it was out on that day.  Too bad...

Warning...this place no longer serves decent food let alone island style eats.  The bento box consisted of the usual rice, piece of spam, what was suppose to be a piece of chicken but cover by a fatty skin, little cubes of meat that looked like leftover cuts from other meals, all cover by a horrid sauce.  SAUCE on everything in a BENTO box!!!  $8.50 for that?? The teriyaki sandwich was really just a burnt cheeseburger with nothing on it. Not even real beef. And with fries? No choice for normal mac salad. Rip off for $5.95 Only thing okay was the poki, because how can you mess up raw fish?  I talked with manager & she said that is the way its been for a year.  I remember when they had good food. Course no one working there is actually from Hawaii anymore so they don't know better. But owners should.  L&L better and that isn't always that great. I'd give this place a zero rating if I could.
One of my favorite places to eat. The adobo is just like grandma used to make. My mouth is watering just writing this.

If you're in the vicinity and you're itching for a plate lunch, this place will scratch the itch a bit.  IMHO, there are way better Island-kine food establishments in Vegas.  I stop in here because it's close to work, centrally located, and like I said, Aloha Kitchen helps scratch at that craving.  Last visit, I tried the beef curry stew, which I think was a special ... it was like a huge chunk of potato, couple pieces of carrot, and some stringy beef, with the requisite large scoops of rice and mac salad.  Not impressed.  Should have stuck with the tried-n-true adobo fried rice omelette.  Service is usually friendly and the wait is not too long.  A big plus is that the interior decor has been spiffed up considerably, the colors are inviting, and it seems much fresher inside.

I been a customer for about 7+ years now and the food/service is great but lately specifically last night they are closing 30 min before the hours of operation posted in the front. I hope someone looks into this issue because it has become more common forcing us to go to other restaurants we really don't crave at that time. I will be back because I love the place but not if this continues... Thanx

Another one of my favorite local spots for Hawaiian food in Vegas! This place is known for the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet. For those of you who doesn't know what Filipino adobo is it is meat simmered with soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns and garlic. This is a staple food with Filipino's and I like to describe this spot as the Hawaiian/Filipino spot. Besides the famous adobo fried rice all their dishes here are pretty ono! So next time you are in Vegas, be sure to check out this spot....you'll love it!

You might ask why four stars.. well cus I could say I've had better, as in taste. But AK will always be in my heart. Mostly cus Me and my friends come here A LOT! And this was the first islander spot I got to try when I first moved to Vegas.. Oh the memories. 

If you always wanted to try something else besides the typical chicken katsu. I suggest trying the Lau-Lau plate. I'd say the prices are pretty reasonable for a quick fix of islander food. 

The parking is plenty. And it's huge for having a family side and a party side. I'm talking about their restaurant and their karaoke bar. So, it's an all-around good chill spot for whatever you wanna do.

Mad this evening with new Mgt. I wanted cabbage in broth, they said they could no longer sell me it because it was not on the menu! All because I made a comment on their under cook cabbage that they try to serve me! 
I had to buy miso soup for one price then add cabbage to it.. and costing me $6.00..
Cook mgt said they are not going play favoritism
for customers that want to eat just vegetables! 

 Aloha kitchen needs to put vegetables on their menu!

How hard is it to grill cabbage on the griddle? I ordered mahi plate that comes with raw cabbage that's placed under the fish. I asked if they can cook the cabbage and they said NO as if it's illegal or something. Last time we're coming to this joint because they won't honor a simple request such as grilled cabbage. Forget this place, Go to L&L instead! Peace
Don't go here! Got FOOD POISONING and I called and they never called me back about it. Say yourself the sickness with the shrimp tempura
Give me some Kalbi!!!  It always gets the job done after hours of partying and even just whenever we crave for some Hawaiian food.  The Hula plate is great too.

So "Aloha" means both hello and goodbye -- now how can I work that into my review?

Here goes:

To begin with it, I've never seen a combination bar and Hawaiian fast food place.

Aloha (Hello) Kitchen reminds me of a typical Hawaiian fast food place: well lit with a lot of cheesy decor.
Besides having the basic plates, they also carried some unique stuff. I tried the Adobo Fried Rice and the wife tried the Saimin soup.  The food wasn't really anything to yelp about, but since it is a chain kinda place, you shouldn't expectation too much.
I'd be willing to go back just because they serve poke (one of the items I don't find at a fast food place) on Friday and Saturday.
So until then, Aloha (Goodbye) Kitchen.

Aloha (Hello) Bar is right next door to the Kitchen but is a 180 from the Kitchen: dark with a dive feel to it.  But it still gave off the laid back Island life vibe.
Bartender was cool and even spoke to me in dakine.  Thanks.
She stopped though when my face went blank and didn't respond.  Sorry.
The music had the kinda beats I could groove to for a couple hours, and the crowd was chill.
After a some drinks and a couple games of pool, I was saying Aloha (Goodbye) Bar.  Good thing since they just fired up the karaoke machine.

Overall, I'll be saying Aloha (Hello) sooner to the Bar than the Kitchen.

A special aloha to all the Vegas Yelpers from Hawaii.
There are a bunch.

So i gotta say im always on a mission to find great local food which in my case local food being from hawaii. And ive heard alot of good things about this place i was not disappointed! The food was def. priced well and the portion size was perfect. The quality of the food was def good as well! The reviews that others have wrote are so so but from hearing other locals in person telling me about this place it made my decision to actually give it a try. If anyone from hawaii is craving good local food this spot is def worth the stop! Price is reasonable and so are the portion sizes!
Rude. Unprofessional staff. Ruins the experience every time. And the food isn't that great to be a repeat customer.

So we came here after dinner to sing a little bit Of Karaoke before going home. This place is mall but quaint. The bartender was really nice and very nice. Didn't miss a step when it came or ordering drinks. The KJ was funny and very upbeat. The crowd was lively in here.  They cheered everyone who sang, which was amazing. We actually had a nice time here and definitely heading back next Saturday. So if you're looking to have a good time, with great people, this is definitely the spot.

This is fast becoming my favorite for Hawaiian Drive-in fare. My meals were made-to-order, well prepared and the portions generous.  I've yet to enjoy the Mahi-Mahi here; due to scarcity, but I will definitely be back hoping to find it. Today's delicacy is Oxtail Soup $11.99; loaded with tender meat; garden vegetables and includes 2 scoops of rice. Buen apetito!
Awesome service, I recently had a party for graduation... Food was so good and had a great time with DJ karaoke.

The Sahara/Decatur location is my favorite local style Hawaiian diner/bar in Vegas. They have a lot of the "Local Grinds" I loved growing up in Hawaii....even poke on Fridays. Karaoke...live bands...UH Football parties during the season...it's just a little taste of Hawaii lifestyle in Vegas. Gotta love it

BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS!!  And if you get the chance, find out when they have their street food cart set up on the sidewalk.  The smell of the BBQ is mouth-watering!  Great food, exceptional prices, highly recommend!

When I lived in Las Vegas, this was my go to place for Hawaiian cuisine. Anytime I craved Hawaiian food, this place hit the spot each time. This place also stays open until really late (yay!). Their portions are very generous and you don't have to wait too long for  your order. Spam musubi and mac salad are my favorite items on the menu and their Loco Moco is pretty legit. Prices are fairly affordable for how much food you get. I loved coming here with a group of friends because they also offer karaoke next door. Tasty food, affordable prices, and karaoke...what more can I ask for?

Spam musubi=good
Chicken katsu=good 
Mac salad=ok
Katsu sauce=bad
Curry sauce=bad

I decided to order some food for pickup after work. Called my order in around 6:50, and it was ready when I got there about 7:10. I ordered the chicken katsu, with a side of curry sauce, and a spam musubi. I have to say the musubi is probably my favorite thing there. The katsu was crispy and hot, but I probably wouldn't order it again. It lacked flavor. The katsu sauce was weird tasting and the curry sauce was lumpy and had an off taste. The Mac salad was warm and tasted just like mayo. I have had much better Hawaiian food at L&L. I probably won't be back, unless it's for the musubi.

Always a great place for delicious Hawaiian comfort food! One of my favorite go too's. Food is always consistent in quality, taste and amount! Fast and friendly local Hawaiian service always sharing the spirit of Aloha! Five star rating well deserved!

The staff is very nice especially Cyndel.

I come here often. The food is great and the price is good given the portions are pretty big. 

My favorite part is the macaroni salad!

Was a terrible place. Was waiting in line for like ten minutes while the people at the counter had a conversation with the customer at the register.  They could have taken my order and I could have been out in the same amount of time. There was literally two customers in the store and I was the other customer. All we wanted was some katsu matsubi. What horrible costumer service. They took the order for the people and then handed their order to them before taking our order. How do you stay in business.

When I come to Vegas, I always have a meal at Aloha Specialties at the Cal. 
The last time around, I came with a few friends that wanted to go to their regular Hawaiian spot. Aloha Kitchen is a fast food restaurant with Hawaiian and Filipino dishes.

One of my fav dishes is the garlic chicken which is what I ordered at Aloha Kitchen. Came with 3 slabs of chicken with skin on, 2 scoops of rice, and mac salad. 
The garlic chicken was just okay. Kind of bland, skin not as crispy as I'd like it to be. Also, I barely was given a scoop of mac salad. 

My friend ordered halo halo which looked disappointing for $5. On the other hand, the adobo omelet looked delicious.

I'll stick to Aloha Specialties the next time around.

I had the fried rice lovers omelette with portugese sausage in it. You can choose from char su pork, portugese sausage, ham or spam. My wife had the bento box with soam, teriyaki beef and chicken. And my mother in law had ox tail soup that comes with 2 scoops of rice as always. No complaints over all, good local food just like home. Lots of seating inside, not sure how the bathrooms were but they have public restrooms. Also a karaoke bar on one side that is separated

Gross. This place makes the worst teriyaki I have ever had. I've given this place 3 chances. They smother it with a sugary thick sauce and then give you little rice. The service is not that great when it comes to the older lady at the front. I have tried the other place on Maryland and it is a little bit better. I think the spam musubi is overpriced as well as all of the food. At least for the taste. Please review your food Aloha Kitchen...I'm headed for the franchised Hawaiian restaurants.
Can anyone tell me the most bussy times ? Like what day and what time would be good to go ?

In the last 5-6 times that I have ordered to go, they have managed to mess up my order in some way. The last 5 times they have shorted me Mac salad. On the 6th time which was a 2 days ago I ordered there kaluha pig no cabbage. When I got home the sauce had completely leaked out of the container and all over the other food. I called them to complain about it. Instead of apologizing the girl behind the counter blamed me asking "did you drop it or something"! This was the worst service ever! I would not eat here again if the food was free. I wasn't asking for a refund or anything. I just wanted them to be more cognizant of what was going on. 

I wouldn't recommend anybody to eat hear if you care about the way you are treated! By far one of the worst experiences ever.
Love it, i love their musubi and that I can place phone orders. They are always quick with their food and also very friendly in person and over the phone .

Bf's favorite place in Vegas, we have to stop here a few times when we're in town. He loves the adobo fried rice omelet. - for me, this place is alright. Everything I have ordered so far has been blah. Nothing memorable and delicious for me to want to come back.. and what's up with the tuna poke here??? Everytime I've asked for it, it was either sold out or not available. I gave up and stopped asking for it after the 5th time lol. 

overall, I've had better hawaiian food but I'll continue to order diff items but not really expecting much from this place

Tried it, hated it. I opened my food to check it, and there was hardly any sauce on it. I asked for a little side cup of the teriyaki sauce and was told that it would be 27 cents. I said it will cost you more to run my card for the charge than you are charging me, and this meat is dry to begin with. The "lady" told me, well it's 27 cents. I said that's fine, I will just go to your competitor next time. She said, "fine goodbye." I hoped that when I got home this would be delicious at least. It wasn't. The fish was gross, the chicken was dry, the shredded mystery meat was gamey. I would rather eat a nasty drive thru burger than this garbage again.

I order the chicken with gravy and a side of Hawaiian iced tea. I love the service of the place I've been coming here since 2011 and the place is well kept and service is good. I love the service of the place due to their welcoming behavior. I live in the Southwest part of town but I still bother driving all the way here at the Decatur location. I will be definitely be coming back.

I have seen a lot of my friends checking in to Aloha Kitchen... Some visiting from Hawaii and others who are LV residents. So, I quickly bookmarked it to try... 
We recently bought tickets to a show, but wasn't too hungry to have dinner before the show, so we opted to eat after the show gets out. One of my friends looked up late night restaurants on Yelp, and found Aloha Kitchen. When he said that they have Oxtail Soup, I said YES!
Oxtail soup is always the right food for late night grindz! The taste is good, but I think it would be better if they had peanuts and Chinese parsley in the soup, like what I'm used to having in my oxtail soup. We had an order of lumpia shanghai too. That also was good.
I wanted to try the adobo fried rice, but there was no way the three of us could finish that, plus all that we ordered. Perhaps next time. See you again in our next visit to LV, Aloha Kitchen! \m/
Best place I've been too ever!!! My wife raved about this place before our trip to Vegas and let me just say they did not disappoint!!!! My new place to eat !!!
I love this place. Service is super fast and the food is tasty and cheap. What more can you ask for? If you like Hawaiian food, you definitely need to come here.

SO MUCH FUN!! The bartender is so kind and has an awesome 'stache, and the DJ is friendly, funny, and awesome!! This was my first time doing a karaoke song (almost by myself) and everyone was so cool and kind (staff and customers). Cripes, there are some people here who can siiiiiing!!!

This place is the place to go to eat some good Hawiian food.. When your done head next door to mingle, drink, and sing some karaoke in the Aloha Bar with a fun colorful bartender. He's wonderful. Its a great experience. One of My favorites.

never had hawaiin food before, wasn't sure what to expect. It was good! atmosphere was lousy.

transfriendly - i guess it was way to busy for anyone to even notice

Met my husband for lunch since this place is close to his office. We placed our orders - an order of lumpia, a beef teriyaki bowl, and a mixed plate - and sat down. I went to fill our cups and the beverage dispenser seemed to be broken...not out of something, but actually broken. It sprayed me with fruit punch which seemed to set the tone for our meal. 

When I got in the bathroom to wash my hands, the bleach smell was overpowering. It was so strong it made my eyes water, and even though I knew bleach had been used, it felt really grimy. Of course there were no paper towels. 

When our order finally came out, the lumpia were nice and hot and crispy. They were the high point of the meal. The beef bowl was smothered in sauce, it didn't taste like any teriyaki sauce I've ever had..almost like a burned gravy. It was disappointing because the beef itself had a good texture, no gristle or fatty globs. 

My husband's chicken was really unappetizing - it honestly looked like a slab of meat from a frozen dinner and he said it was rubbery. He described his beef as being "well done and then some." Not a fan. 


There are too many good Hawaiian places in this town to settle for mediocrity, and that's definitely where this place ranked for me. The staff was friendly, and the dining area was clean, but the cons definitely outweighed the pros here.

Super awesome food. Decent dining area reminds me of LnL type. They actually had manapua, didn't get to try it. We ordered Kailua pig n cabbage, Kalbi, chicken katsu, and Teri chicken. Oh and the French fries! The oil was fresh and fries were crunchy.  They have Hawaiian sun drinks and fountain drinks. Overall better than aloha specialties in Main Street and closer to The Orleans if you staying there. If in Vegas again and I want my local Hawaii food...I'd go here. Didn't go in the bar. Hope this establishment remains clean and nice.
Whenever I'm feeling for some of the local food. Aloha kitchen is the place to be. Food is great, prices are decent. Adobo fried rice of is one my favorites and I'm pretty sure I'm not the only one.

i LOVE aloha kitchen. their food is delicious, food portions are generous and food prices are cheap! clean place, fast and friendly serivce, one of the best little local spots for foodies. I love the adobo fried rice and spam masubis yum!

I usually don't leave reviews. But after the dinner I just had. I had to come on and express how terrible this place is. We were the 1st ppl to Order. After about 35 minutes I notice that there are about 6 groups of people that all have their food. While we get 2 dishes brought out to us. When I asked them about the rest of the food. They say it's almost done. I've heard good things about this place. But I think that goes to show that you shouldn't always believe what you hear. 45 minutes into our dinner we finally just get a refund and leave. To top it all off. The Loco Moco that I got has to be the worst I have ever had in my life. And I'm polynesian. I've eaten Loco Moco from everywhere I know sells it. And this was the worst. Meat was dry. Little bit of gravy. And only 1 piece of meat. I would not recommend this place to my biggest enemy. If they had only half a stay that's what they would get

I come here often. Food is good and all but customer service is horrible. Specially over the phone. I made a pick-up order, got to the restaurant and one of my orders was not  included in the order. Girl taking my order implied that I did not order it over the phone. For the sake of argument I said it's okay just put in the order. She keeps implying that we didn't order it and that I am rude. I told her she shouldn't talk to their customers like that. She said she's been in customer service longer than I have lived. And kept saying I'm rude in Tagalog which is a Philippine dialect. Worst experience ever. And this was all happening in front of the manager and she just stood their. And did nothing. Very disappointed of the restaurant.

Five words: Pork Adobo Fried Rice Omelet

Whaaaa???? I looked at the Hubby like he was crazy when he told me he was going to order this. Apparently a good friend recommended this to him. A true must-order if you're in Vegas and worth driving off the strip for. The fried rice is so tasty - not too salty but the perfect marriage of tangy and saltiness. It reminded me of my Mom's adobo and I have yet to find a place who can cook adobo like my Mom. It's pretty big too - think of a 1lb burrito you'd order from a mexican shop only instead of a torilla, it's egg. We also had their SPAM musubi and mixed BBQ plate...can't complain. It was all good. Friendly service, tons of parking, open late...I'm coming back for you Aloha Kitchen! :)

First time here. Ordered the Adobo omelet. So good. The portion was big enough to feed 3 people. The taps I log is also bomb. I had a fast in corn beef too, it was amazing. We wanted to hang out in the bar but is wasn't open yet so there will be a next time. We took an uber since we where visiting but there is plenty of parking. Lots of people inside eating. It's located in a strip mall so if you want to walk around after some heavy food you can do it. Ordering was easy and they don't have water available at the beverage station they actually bring the water and condiments to your table number. The workers are very friendly and the restrooms where ordinary. We will be back

Everyone has hyped this place up soooo much for me but its pretty average.

A big plus that its open late, and that food is tasty, good portions, but my personal preferences wont allow me to say this place is a have-to stop by everytime type of place.

I had the Garlic chicken, which consists of a pan grilled chicken fillets smothered
With garlic gravy, on rice and mac salad. Im not a fan of overly sticky/mushy rice so
I just ate it with the MacSalad. Pretty goood.  Tastes identical to the grilled chicken plates from Chinese fusion cafes.

Besides that i give them props for
The hours theyre open, and the promptness of the food. Not a place id crave.

Howzit Boo? That's how i said hello to them, but they thought i was crazy. I guess they don't know their pidgeon skills. I would think working at this place they would know how to speak a bit of pidgeon. The food definitely broke da maut, but maybe because i was drunk at 4 in the morning. 

Ordered the Portuguese Sausage with egg over rice. Added tons of ketchup on there and had a great drunken meal! Got my Hawaiian Sun Lilikoi drink.. felt like i was at rainbow drive in all over again... NOT! hhaha far from it, but it's close enough since were about 2000 miles away! 

Mahalo Brah! Aloha

Not real local food. And this is coming from a local from the big Island of hawaii. More Filipino with a couple of local basics. Fast service though and nice clean restaurant. Go to ISLAND FLAVOR. They have real local food, owner is from Hawaii and great family oriented and friendly true hawaiian style restaurant. None of this fusion crap. Local food is already a fusion, why would you need to fuse it more lol.

Drink: 0/5
Decor: 5/5
Cleanliness: 2/5
Service: -2/5
Avg: 1.25 stars

Short Version:
The new decor is nice. The doorman and waitress were nice. The KJ and bartender are rude. KJ not aware of standard queue protocols and what songs are in the library. The bartender would rather argue about a drink and try to intimidate a customer than own his mistakes. The upside is that the staff should turn over in a few months (if their trend keeps up). Maybe we'll try again then. Toilet handle broken. Bathroom dirty. 

Long version:
This used to be a fun karaoke place. Their main host has changed, and they have struggled to find a replacement. Everyone in here was new the last time that we went, which isn't too surprising because it seemed every few months there was a different team there. 

The customer service is horrible. I asked for a Black Label with a splash of soda and was given Black Label and tonic. I walked to the bar and let the waitress know as she is swamped and has the entire room. She apologized and let the bartender know. He comes to me and says, "I put soda in there." Then he holds up the store brand bottle they got at a grocery store and shakes it in my face. I told him, "If you're not convinced, taste the drink. It's tonic and not what I ordered." He stares and me. I don't blink. He grabs the glass and throws it in the sink and says, "Fine." Then he gets a cup and brings the soda bottle and says, "This says soda." He pours it in a cup and asked me to taste it. I tell him that it is soda. He then says, "Good. I don't want to waste this stuff (holding the Scotch bottle). It's not cheap." He proceeds to make me a scotch and soda, which isn't what I ordered. I just didn't care anymore. 

I sit down in the booth. The host comes to me and says, "We don't have this song." I tell her, "Yes, you do. I've sang it here before." She comes back and tells me that she found it. When it's finally my fiancé's turn, she plays the wrong song. He tries to help her find the right one because he has sang it there before. Finally, he tells her that he'll give her a different song, so she bumps him to the bottom of the queue! How? This is your mistake, and he gets punished for your incompetence. After 7 songs, I get up to ask when he is going. She says, "Soon enough." I told her, "I needed a specific number of turns because you put him at the bottom for your mistake." She glared at me and said, "Three." I told her, "Thank you."

Bathroom was dirty. Toilet hand was broken. Only one bathroom now. No one cares.

Horrible!  I'm from Hawaii and I was really disappointed.  It was a cold day so I wanted something warm so I got the saimin.  Yeah... bad choice.  Reminded me of the saimin I ordered at high school football games in Hawaii.  Could have bought it for $1 at the market and made it at home.

My sister ordered a combo plate and it was really greasy.  We got the banana lumpia and it was rock hard and greasy.  

Sad :(
Always enjoy going to this place. I don't think it's overpriced or anything, but I can only take Aloha Kitchen in monthly doses. My favorites are the chicken katsu and kalbi.

Love this place. Can never go wrong with 
The adobo fried rice omelette . Tried the banana mac pancake and Ono too !

I love this place but am only giving it four stars because the only thing I've ever eaten from here is the spam musubi. Spam musubi isn't hard to make at all but there's something about the way this place makes it that just keeps me coming back. 

My only suggestion is make sure you get and keep your receipt because though they may have been standing RIGHT THERE as you ordered your food, they will NOT give you your food unless you can prove you ordered it LOL. That was annoying.
Sometimes I just crave local hawaiian plates and this is one of my favorite spots. My spam musubi pit stop. I love the fried saimin too!
The food used to be great..it changed. The kalbi ribs are too sweet and the meat got thinner. The macadamia pancake is too sweet.
I've been coming here for years and I absolutely love it here. There's a lot of nasty comments out there but I've never had a problem here. Their clean and fast!

Late night munchies after you hit the clubs? This is the place to be! Along with the good food, there is also an annex type kareoke bar you can enjoy after the food! Please do not come in intoxicated and annoying though, because you will get kicked out!! No soliciting please!

I love it here! I haven't tried the karaoke (which I hear great things about) but this is my go to place when I have a hankering for delicious hawaiian food, late at night especially. I love that they're open late; the menu is very reasonably priced. The kalbi bbq is out of this worrrrlldddd, I am obsessed with how it's marinated. I like the chicken katsu as well, and the banana pancakes are a really nice finishing touch if you like dessert. I only knocked it down a star because I don't prefer the katsu curry style here, it's like they give you a side of stew with potatoes and carrots to pour over katsu. I personally prefer L&L's style of katsu curry when it comes to that. Still love everything else though!

Last week - I dropped by the Aloha Kitchen and Bar for lunch. Had high hopes that this would be a location that would come close to being like the food I love and miss when I'm back home on the islands. However - I've learned to live with disappointment in life and my visit here was just another added to that list. 

The dining area is nice - somewhat clean, open and modern(ish) compared to other "local" style restaurants I've been to. The names of the dishes were promising and the prices seemed in line with the portion sizes I had seen on people's tables as I waited to place my order.
