I was coming down with a cold so I wanted saimin - even with it being in the 90's and humid which they don't serve. A Hawaiian style restaurant that doesn't serve saimin - odd. Even fast food joints in Hawaii serve saimin.  At least they serve fried saimin. So, I settled for that. 

Too much vegetables which normally isn't a bad thing however, after a few bites, I started to separate the cabbage and celery. Sorted thru and picked out the minced meat and noodles and with the leftover vegetables, it looked like I hadn't made a dent in the plate. I also chose a side of macaroni salad. Ugh. 

All I'm going to say is that I have to wonder if the cooks have ever been to the islands. Either that or the cooks have started tayloring their dishes to the tastes of people who haven't been either. Or maybe, I didn't choose the right dishes that they specialize in ... whatever the case, I didn't like what I ordered and I doubt I'll be back any time soon.
Aloha Kitchen! Can never go wrong when you want some quick Hawaiian food. My favorite Hawaiian chain in Vegas. I always get the Local Plate. Bbq beef, chicken, and two spam musubis. Highly recommend!

My review will strictly be on what I ordered:

Kalbi - These were just ok.  The marinade was nothing special... pretty much what I expected which was overly sweet with not much of a complexity of flavoring agents.  The meat itself was probably the thinnest cut of short ribs I have ever seen.  Even L&L serves up a thicker slab.

Katsu - This was actually pretty good.  Tender and juicy interior with a super crispy and light exterior.  Unfortunately I was not diggin' the dipping sauce.. it just tasted like hoisin mixed with oyster sauce.

Chicken Teriyaki - The teriyaki sauce is horrible.  It was thickened with so much cornstarch that it didn't have much flavor.  

Adobo Omelette -  Don't know what everyone is raving about.  Imagine leftover adobo that mom made from the night before, which was fried with some leftover rice the next morning, then wrapped in a blanket of the flattest scrambled eggs I have ever sunken my teeth into.  I mean don't get me wrong, it definitely has that "homemade" and "comfort food" spot we all have, but please do not go out of your way just to make this purchase.

Mac Salad - Typical island mac.. peppery, sweet, & mayo-y.

Rice - Super sticky to the point where the rice balls on my plate were a congealed mass of mush.

Spam Musubi - Well, you can't mess up spam, but you can mess up the complimenting sauce and well, the sauce that was slathered between the spam and the rice did the spam musubi no justice.

OVERALL:  Not worth another penny from my wallet.  Maybe it would've been better if it were drunk food.  Also, the people that work here weren't very friendly.  Not one person had a smile on their face.

Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Good enough to get my Hawaiian/Asian food whenever the craving hits.

Only downside: minimum $5 for any debit/credit card transactions. 
Ugh...that was annoying. I only wanted to order my usual chicken bowl, with tax it was around $4 and some change. So I had to order something that I had no intention to get in the first place. Even Mc Donalds takes debit/credit card with NO minimum amount...get your ish together Aloha Kitchen.

Open until 3am, so it's a top choice for late night Hawaiian Filipino fusion. Just make sure to get there before 2:30am, that's when the kitchen closes. 

We ordered the Loco moco $6.29, which was classically prepared: hamburger patty topped with a thick gravy and a fried egg all over rice. The hamburger meat was dry and the gravy was lacking much flavor. My boyfriend loves loco moco, but he wasn't happy with this version. I've came to the conclusion that I'm just not a fan of loco moco in general. I suppose I've just never had one that blew my tastebuds away. It's typically pretty bland with no real explosion or layers of flavor. I also can't get past the weird cornstarch gravy consistency. 2/5

The chicken katsu plate $7.69, came with a generous portion of fried chicken with 2 scoops of rice, one scoop of macaroni salad and a side of katsu sauce. The chicken was super crispy and fried to a dark golden brown (no it didn't taste burned), it was actually pretty moist inside. I've had better katsu sauce, but it wasn't bad - it was simple and does the job. Other than that, I didn't have any real complaints with this dish. A great price for what you get. Just make sure you're prepared for the food coma afterwards, it settles like a brick in your stomach. 4/5

The mac salad was simple, (just tatsted like mayo) but I enjoyed it. It went perfectly with the katsu plate. I ended up ordering an additional side for $1.99. The perfect bite: dip chicken katsu into katsu sauce, take a bite with rice and some mac salad all together... Perfect! 4/5

The spam musubi $1.99, was about the length of a dollar bill and had a thin slice of spam (didn't even fill the length of the musubi), some sweet gravy-like-sauce, and a brick of rice held together by seaweed. There was a ton of rice, but I ate it carefully making sure that each bite actually got some spam and sauce in, and it was pretty good. 3/5

Usually go to many of the other Hawaiian food joints but been hearing about this one for a while so I figured I try it. It's very much like the drive inn restaurants back home. Very casual, cheap, and good plate lunches.

I've been here many times for lunch during work hours and today was no different. The people are not very personable. They take your order and that's really the only time you speak with them. I've had many different things from there because they do have some good food. The only thing I got this time was spam mitsubi. If you've never had it I recommend giving it a try.

We love coming to Aloha Kitchen for their yummy food! Whenever my husband feels homesick we get Hawaiian food and Aloha Kitchen always fills us up! We like to come to this location because they're open later than the one by our home. 
We like all their foods, but my kids favorite is the Fried Saimin. 
The staff is always friendly and the eating area is always clean when we chose to eat in.

I like this place. It's not my favorite but then again I don't care for Hawaiian food that much. I do have some times where I crave it though and that's enough for me to say I like it! It's clean, good cheap food, and the workers are nice, It's not a place I'd go out of my way for but I'd definitely eat there!

Simply the best! I visit Vegas once a month for work and I have to come here or l just doesn't feel complete. Can't go wrong with the Kalbi Combo!!! I can't believe this place doesn't have 5 star average...so underrated!
This has to be the BEST Hawaiian dining here in Las Vegas! 10x better & more authentic than L&L! I had a combo plate! & it was definitely super filling !
Local Kine Grindz! When you are in the mood for some food that sticks to your ribs and transports you back to 808, this is the spot. A can't miss while your in vegas!

Just what I expected - great service and excellent local (Hawai'ian) plates at a great price.  I had the curry chicken and katsu topped off with Filipino karioka for dessert.  Yummers!!!  Honestly I was so excited that they had the karioka that I inhaled them first and even went back later that night to buy two more after I went out to dinner!  I wasn't crazy about the Mac salad, which was disappointing because a good Mac salad is a great compliment to an excellent local plate.  There was some kind of funny after taste to it.  Perhaps it was a bad batch of mayo or something but hopefully next time I dine there, they can rectify that.  Also was disappointed that although they had Pepsi products, they did not carry Mountain Dew, my vice, lol.  I may sound nit-picky but believe it or not, I've chosen Pepsi product restaurants over Coca-Cola establishments simply because of the beverage choices.

I will be spending the month of March in Vegas so expect me to be a frequent customer here!  So ono!!!

Came her 2x during a 5 day visit in LV. I would have come a 3rd time but was running late for my flight home. Customer service is good when they greet you hello and goodbye. When your on a budget and got to feed a family of 7; hit up aloha kitchen for some good eats at a fair price. The worst expensive item is the hawaiian sun; $1.50ea. Only bad thing I saw during my visits is the short Latin guy was counting money at the other register with gloves. Once finished he helped out filling orders of food while using the same gloves! Ewwww! Btw... Don't mind the lost/missing sign in the front of the building. Their open lol

A last minute decision to go and was happy that I stopped in!
Found local grinds and priced just right. 
Plenty of room for any size of party and the service was prompt.

Everyone ate everything on their plates and for sure I know we will be back.  From hamburger steak to fried rice, we did NOT leave hungry.

Ate here twice with my group because the food was so good and cheap! You can tell a place is good when the local people eat here. I had the Korean ribs one night, fried rice the next with egg and both were delicious. I would recommend this place if you are looking for good, local eatery.

Kalbi Combo - This eatery is bomb-tastic! Customer service was good. Food was amazing! Definitely worth a visit! Unlike other Hawaiian places this has to be the best tasting one! Don't settle for L&L come to Aloha Kitchen & make the most of the flavors & portion you get from here for a reasonable price!

My favorite splurg is Hawaiian food. I thought is give this place a try. I ordered the chicken Terryaki plate. Although flavorful, they leave the skin on the chicken which has a lot of fat. I'm not a fan of it. The macaroni salad was ok but not amazing. The food did come out quickly and the customer service was great. But I'll stick to my other local favorite Hawaiian place.

This is my favorite place to get hangover food...LOL. I usually get the adobo fried rice omelet. If you haven't had it you need to try it...it's delicious. The only thing is if you sit in the dining room the service isn't the greatest. Very slow.

Love this place! It's such good comfort food! The food come out so quick and hot! The Loco Moco is a must! The owners are the sweetest and make you feel right at home! Don't forgot to order a few spam musubi to go!

Upon my first visit here, I was a little worried. Hawaiian style local restaurants are usually hit or miss..they give you a ton of food and you have to take the plunge and either feel crappy afterwards or go into the loveliest food coma known to man. This one was the latter. The food was delicious and the service was decently quick, I just don't understand why they put the soda machine on the other side of the line...so annoying. Fat spam musubi too. It's alriggghttttt, I'd go here again if I was craving island food in Vegas.

I go here usually every Sunday and is usually somewhat busy. They have amazing food but I usually order the Local Plate which comes with chicken, beef, macaroni salad, spam musubi and rice. Workers are very friendly and the place is sanitary. Would definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

Love the teriyaki combo plate! When I think Hawaiian food I think of this place! This branch! The best in town! 

You walk in go the counter and order. You can get a fountain drink or opt for Hawaiian Sun. I'm all about Hawaiian Sun passion fruit. Ok so I always get the combo plate teriyaki. It comes with chicken, beef and pork smothered in teriyaki yummy sauce with two scoots of rice and one scoop of the best macaroni salad!!! It's a huge plate but if you are like me it's one of those plates that you keep eating because it tastes soooo freaking good!!! 

You order and sit down they bring the food out to you on real plates with real silverware and some napkins. I love that they are open until 4am! Maybe because they have a karaoke bar next door.

I love this place I'll be back!!!!

I've gone to aloha kitchen my whole life and never had a problem. On Friday 11/17/17 my friends and I were eating, and thiis guy joined us. We asked the manager for a refund, but they refused. They been on dirty dining before, I thought they solved the problem. Apparently not .

Best food I have had in a long time! Fusion of hawaiian, filipino, korean, japanese . I ordered the kalbi combo and split the adobo rice with a friend. My taste buds where going crazy. Each thing on my plate was cooked well. The kalbi was grilled just right, the katsu was evenly fried to a golden crisp and the rice was cooked perfectly to my liking. I could eat here everyday but I'd probably get a heat attack. At least I'd die happy right?!

I decided that I would try this place considering I have not been here in a few years, since the Webjoy days (for those of you who are familiar). I used to get the chicken teriyaki bowl, but I walked in asking what would the employee prefer.

The kalbi plate happened to be the preference today. I dislike white rice, so I had to get a salad as a replacement. (a little bit of an off taste) I believe the teriyaki chicken is still great! Each bite had a crunch with just enough flavor to keep you wanting more. The kalbi and chicken katsu almost seemed like fillers though.

Next time, I will get the chicken teriyaki plate. No exceptions.
Always a win. Prefer the maryland location tbh. Go rebels student special fried chicken wit gravy on the side.

Go for the adobo omelette! It's a huge portion so make sure your stomach's ready for it. Tapsilog is also a must but gotta get it early coz they always sell out of it. Everything I've had off their menu has been good and the service is always great. :)

This isn't local food.   Garlic chicken was BBQ Chicken with garlic powder and then they drowned it in gravy!   I wouldn't order again.    In fact, $12 for a plate of (so-called) garlic chicken and veggies.   Forget it.   No Aloha at all.

Based on a recommendation, I was eager to try Aloha Kitchen.  I have to say I was not very impressed with the food.  I ordered the mix plate combination which came with beef, teriyaki chicken, and mahi (in egg batter).  The mac salad, the rice, and the beef were fine but I found the teriyaki sauce overwhelming and the mahi not very fresh.  They do give you a ton of food for a reasonable price.  Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  I also didn't care for the clean-up involving a ladder and lots of dust during lunch hour over the soda machine and the cups.
Everyone raves about the adobo fried rice, so that's what i tried. it wasn't busy when i got here and the food was a bit too oily for my taste and it wasn't as good as imagined it to be.
Good Hawaiian/Filipino place. The local plate is our fave with the spam musubi. Adobo omelette is the other one

I've been coming here since time immemorial. Still no WiFi????
Food is ok, place is ok, Karaoke is fun... I get it business is business but these days an establishment that neglects its customers, loyal customers, of WiFi signal so we can chill in a place becomes "skeptical". It ain't that expensive to provide customers this modern service. It's free advertisement if people can connect to YELP for business establishments.

This is like my second home when I visit vegas . I been coming here for a decade now.. and love it here. Mackly is an amazing entertainer and the people that come here are down to earth. Can get a little ghetto st times but it's all good fun.

This little hole in the wall gem is in a not-so-great area of town kind of in the parking lot of an industrial strip.  But go inside and the menu makes you feel like you've landed in a slice of Honolulu.  Teriyaki beef and chicken plate lunch, spam musubi, loco moco and macaroni salad.  Unless you've grown up with it you don't really appreciate how good it is here--better than a lot of places in Hawaii.

Order at the counter, sit at one of the linolium booths and they will bring the food to you when it's ready.  Reasonably priced, friendly service and good portions.  It's not the healthiest stuff but it fills the urge and you won't find anything like for miles around.

Open till the wee hours of the morning?  Meaning the dozen of us drunk girls can get food?  Bless you.  Adobo omelet with extra adobo sauce?  Thank you.  Letting that sauce marinate in the leftovers till tomorrow morning so we can groan about never drinking again while devouring everyone's food before they wake up?  Awesome.  Other things that tasted delicious:  spam musubi, local plate, some teriyaki plate.

Service was so sweet and kind.  They also have a bar in the back, but we were not in any condition to go into that.  Price is great, if I attended college out this way I would've gained a thousand pounds, haha.

We'll always be back here!

I was in Vegas last month and I was introduced to Aloha Kitchen.  By the time I left to go back to San Diego, I had eaten there twice and both times i ordered their adobo omelette.  I can honestly say that was the best omelette I've ever had.

BIL (Brother-in-law) turned 21 and wanted to karaoke. Wanted general not private room and found this gem. Such great fun and special memories. 

Would absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking to have a good night.

Always a must when in Vegas. 
A little bit of hawaiian with a little bit of filipino flavor. LOOVINN IT.

My favorite choices are the short ribs SO GOOOOOD. & the adobo fried rice. 
The appetizers such as lumpia and spam musubi are alriiight. Not as good as momma's homemade, so stick to the entrees. 

Now all that needs to happen now is for them to open up locations in SoCal (;
Always here on Sundays and every time great food and nice to chill while listening to karaoke. Great people.

What a bad service!
They screwed up on delivery one day.
I called them on missing food item.
They promised me a credit for that particular item and will honor it the next time I order.
Well, when I ordered the next time for delivery, I mentioned the credit I have and wanted to use it towards my order.  They still insisted I need to order minimum of $10 for delivery.  What ever happened to my credit?
I guess I got screwed out of my money.
All you people out there ordering for delivery, make sure everything is in your bag before paying the money.  Don't use credit card for payment.  Because if they screw up of your order, it is too late.  They got your money and will end up like me.
And I hope you speak Pilipino, because the delivery person doesn't speak a word of English only Pilipino. Therefore, good luck communicating with delivery person if they screw up on your order. 
Best thing to do is to order somewhere else.  Not Aloha Kitchen.
Also, they should change their name since they have no Aloha Spirit.

POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!
at the register a guest asked to exchange his order. He was told once the order is out they don't take it back. 
When our order came the chicken Katsu was obviously burnt hence the darkness of the coating. When my daughter-in-law took it back they told her "it's because of the oil" she ask for a refund they offered her to exchange. She declined. The cook remembered her when she returned a plate of chicken katsu that was still pink inside. Proceeded to tell the cashier if they  refund her she will no longer be serviced there. 
Once I ordered a dish when it came I advised the cashier it wasn't what I ordered and she stood there disagreeing with me. She wouldn't correct my order. Very sad customer service.

My favorite place for Hawaiian food ! I don't go often but when I do there's always that same consistency in knowing that whatever I get it'll be good :) 

We ate - kalbi ribs plate , bbq chicken plate, and the mixed plate . Prices are very reasonable and the amount of food they give is generous . They swapped out my side of macaroni salad for mixed veggies even though that's not a listed side :) . 

The kalbi ribs plate is my go to . I love the flavor and the meat is juicy and cooked perfectly .

Okay, I decided to come back here again despite my previous review. But oh boy do I regret it. 
I don't comprehend how difficult it is to get something cooked well done. I love crispy and burned edges on my skinless chicken and Kalbi ribs. I always let them know and even tell them twice.
To top it off we also order egg rolls which are my favorite and a side of lumpia. Well guess what, they never came. We waited and waited for nothing.
Eventually when we were finished w/ out food we decided to get a refund because this was ridiculous.
Over all I will NOT COME BACK to this location ever again!

I came here with my friend after trying to figure out what to eat after a good night out on new years eve.  Plus I haven't eaten hawaiian food in a real long time so I figure why not since friend already ate here before and loved it.  

I like the decor.  It reminds me of Teri Cafe in San Diego.  There is plenty of parking since it's in a shopping center, which is a plus in my book.  I was surprised to see some filipino dishes on the menu but too bad we didn't get any.  This time we ordered the breakfast plate - 1 spam because I love spam and gotta have my spam and the other one was Portuguese sausage.  I'm not too big on the portuguese sausage so I thought it was alright.  But the spam plate was yummy.  It also reminded me of the mickey d's food in hawaii so that brought back some memories.  Prices are pretty decent too since coming from LA, they're a little bit cheaper than what we serve.  I would definitely go back if I'm in the area next time and craving some hawaiian food.

I used to come here n pick up my lunch all the time and it's been a while n today I craved some Hawaiian food n called to place an order for pick up. They put me on hold for about good 10 minutes so I hung up n tried again n the background noise was so loud we couldn't hear each other n made me worried if she got my order correctly. when I picked up my food that I used to order all the time didn't look or the taste the same anymore...maybe cooks or owner has been changed or what but, I won't b coming back here for a while...

Glad I found this spot. Loved the adobo and adobo fried rice omelet. Haven't had a chance to try the other stuff but everything that I saw really reminded me of back home aka Hawaii. Next time I'll try the Hawaiian plate! Definitely coming back next time I'm in LasVegas.
The chicken teriyaki was very fatty and mostly dark meat. The sauce seemed to have a lot of cornstarch or other thickening agent. It's open late, has low prices, and has relatively fast service.

I love this place there students specials never disappoint me and always fit in my budget but really I'm writing this review cause it was my turn to go for lunch. So of course it rained today and the place was packed. My office order was 2 bags and 3 drinks so since I only have two arms I asked for a cup holder they were out so instead of seeing me struggle they came from around the cashiers desk and helped me carry the 3 drinks out so very nice. She even complemented my car so sweet!! Love this place.

Gotta love Aloha Kitchen!! Today's customer service experience wasn't as good as I normally get any other time but that doesn't take away from the fantastic food!! I am a huge fan of the chicken katsu with extra teriyaki sauce but today I wanted to do the local plate which comes with teriyaki chicken, beef and two spam masubi's! Yum!! They are for the most part fast on the food and getting it out to you when you choose to dine in but today was extremely slow because there must have been a terrible discrepancy  in the customer before me had ordered! Which then cause our order to be put to the back! Short ribs are a really good choice as well! I will definitely be back so they can redeem themselves because today was less than average regardless of what's going on the customer service HAS to stay on point!
This place has may have the best food to offer but the service is not that great.They need training in giving good service to get better reviews.

Whenever my friends and I visit Vegas, we have to come to Aloha Kitchen. The adobo omelette is sooo good and so large it's ridiculous. How I wish there was an Aloha Kitchen in San Diego so I could eat an adobo omelette everyday.

The food was good but only if they gave you enough of it and when we picked up our to go order the girl in the pink shirt sneezed into her hands and without trying to wash her hand or anything she grabbed our food with her dirty hands.
Nice place. Kalbi ribs with kimchi there rock! I return there every once in 2-3 weeks. Service is okay, too.

Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, and I have tried all other "Hawaiian food" places in vegas. No body beats Aloha Kitchen Delicious!! But be prepared to wait at least 15-20 min for you food it's always busy but worth the wait! The only thing I hate is the bar next to it sometimes I can smell that "bar/cigarette" smell in the restaurant.

I'm addicted to gravy so i always get the loco moco. Its basically a burger patty & 2eggs of your choice on top of the rice drenched with gravy!! Also have to try the lumpia shanghai. Service is fast eventho everytime we come here there's a line. :-)

This place was yuck. I saw that they deliver and since I cant leave work I thought I would give them a try. It was totally disgusting and they took forever. They said between 15 and 30 minutes and that there would be a 3 dollar delivery charge. Not many places have delivery charges but when they do I expect the food to come within the time frame given. Not 20 minutes after the 45 minutes had already passed. I hope the delivery guy considers the fee his tip. The local plate was disgusting, greasy and the musubi smelled rank and old. The mac salad wasnt bad and the lupia was actually great. I will not be coming here ever again. Still a bad taste in my mouth.

It's been a year since I've last been here but my goal was to have a great night of karaoke fun & drinks.

The good news is that our favorite KJ Mack was stills here doing his karaoke magic and of course having hawaiian food is always an extra bonus.

The lounge was about half full when we arrived but as the night continued on it definitely turned into an epic party house with a great vibe.

From karaoke singing, dancing, and comedy from the lounge hosts, KJ Mack & Barman Chris, this is definitely a place to come have fun.

:)

No need to drive downtown for oxtail soup.  Aloha Kitchen's is pretty good.  Plus the soup flavor makes me eat my carrots :P.  Great how this spot is open late.  Menu has delish selections and they carry Hawaiian Sun.

Parking lot at night has good lighting and its easy to find parking.  I noticed there's a wine bar a few doors down.  But Aloha Kitchen also has a bar.  All the more fun... there's karaoke.  Overall it's a cool place to hangout and support the daring ones who belt out their voices in front of strangers.  We heard some great voices too; like competition material ;)

Service always has the aloha spirit each time we've been here.  They work late and they're still super nice.  Our food was even brought over to the bar section.  Note that in the bar area there is a two drink minimum to kick it there.  

Comfy food, cool hangout, offers casual dining section and karaoke bar, serves liquor, and super friendly service. Who said you can't find the island in the desert?

As everyone else has raved, the adobo fried rice is amazing. Who knew taking left over adobo, shredding it up and combining it with fried rice would be so wonderful? Did I mention they take all that and wrap it in a giant omelet? I'm a pretty big guy, who am I kidding I'm fat, but approach the menu with caution. This is where your eyes crave more than your stomach actually has capacity for. Though when is that not the case anyways?! The spam musubi is decent and I've only had a few other things from the menu that looks as big as a Baskin Robbins 31 flavors listing. I've not dared to venture further from what I know here, not because I'm scared but because I only eat here once or twice a month. For those few times a month, I'm already craving the adobo fried rice omelet. 

Caution: the omelet is pretty overwhelming 3/4 of the way through. If you've never had it or seen it before, do not be fooled by the name of it if you were to assume it be the size of a standard size omelet. It's the size of a newborn wrapped in an egg. 

Hopefully you enjoy it as much as I have!

We've been here several times and can affirm that it is a reasonable meal for a reasonable price. It is pretty basic stuff that shouldn't really disappoint anybody. But at the same time, you are not likely to be blown away. 

My only complaint is the heavy usage of a very sweet teriyaki sauce on many of the dishes. The bottom line is that Island Style on Sahara (and in the Green Land Market) does a similar menu much, much better.

not much of a fan of filipino food. but this mixture was too good! its a hole in the wall restaurant. my bf & i ordered the adobo fried rice omelet & a macaroni salad came out to be less than $10. macaroni salad was really small & not that tasty for $2. but the adobo fried rice omelet was good! add some sriracha. yums.

Bomb authentic hawaiian food. I come here atleast 3/4 times a month. 24hours and the nicest people work here. they even bring you your food to your table if you dine. this place hits the spot for late night food cravings. expect to spend about 8$ to 12$ for a meal after tax. which is very worth it for the amount and quality of food.

Yummy and cheap, cheap, cheap. 
The boy and I were looking for a place to stop at on our way home from Chinese New Year, and decided to stop here, never having tried a hawaiian place before.. Which aparently, is an awful lot like Japanese? I guess? But with pineapples?
Anyways, the boy got a teriyaki chicken bowl for under $4, and I got the garlic chicken with gravy for $7. Mine came with macaroni salad, which was meh. No real flavor at all to it. I'd probably just skip that part next time. But the garlic chicken was sooo so good, and the portion size was massive, 3 pieces of chicken and two rice scoops. I had to take half home. 
The boy liked his teriyaki chicken bowl as well. Not as much food as the garlic chicken, but still more than enough. The teriyaki sauce had a nice pineapple tang to it, and the chicken was super tender.
Best place in town for Kalbi Robs. Better than anything I found on the Big Island. The other meats not so much.

Aloha Kitchen is located in a strip mall on the Westside.  I came here primarily for their oxtail soup.  Yup.  Here I go again searching for oxtail soup.

Celery , carrots, ginger , and onions were swimming in this hearty oxtail soup as the meat literally fell off the bone as you work around it.  It was savory good and wayyyyyyy better than Market Street Cafe!  Like ten times better! 

Aside from what brought me here, their Portuguese sausage and spam plate was also decent. We also grabbed some spam musubi to go just in case we get hangry on the road! 

I'm so happy i yelped this place.  Now I know where to go to get my oxtail soup fix when in Vegas without having to inhale all that cigarette smoke going into a casino!!!



#tyyelpyoudidit!

Now this place is good for good food for a decent buck. I usually get the teriyaki chicken bowl and for 3.99 it's actually pretty good. But I tried their chicken adobo this morning and it was the worst chicken adobo I have ever had. There was no sauce at all. The plate was drenched in oil. The adobo was so goddamn old and the meat was fucking disgusting. 

Now listen, I'm not bashing Aloha Kitchen, I still think that they have a decent selection of food for a fair price. Go to this place, and try anything else, I'm sure you will enjoy it! But whatever you do, stay away from the adobo.

I usually drive down to Las Vegas to have a good time, gamble, walk the strip and eat at different restaurants but once in a while I get a craving for Adobo Fried Rice Omelette from Aloha and its just that good that I have to have some. Next time I'll try to try some other dishes that they offer but for now, Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is my favorite!!!

Shout out to our Bartender Nellie!!! You are the best! Thank you for making sure my family who came out of Town for a family wedding was taken care had drinks in their hand. We came it was packed we asked Nellie if we could have the next available table to celebrate Mr. and Mrs. Fuimaono wedding party. Nellie was quick.  We end up taking over the entire place. Everyone had such a great time. We will see you again when we have another celebration to come out for.

I eat here a lot but today really irritated me. I ordered some food, paid for it, then the cook says they're all out. Ok so I chose something else that's the same price. I had 3 items that I ordered so they only voided 1. Or was strange to me because it was the same price so why not just swap it? So it gets voided, then I get charged again for my next order. The cashier is flustered, which is understandable because she now has 4 different receipts. As she calls people over to help, things keep getting worse. Voids here and there, then hey need to charge me again. So at this point I'm frustrated and my food is sitting on the counter getting cold. Idk if I'll come back to this location, I go out of my way to come here, but this might have been the last time. Management needs to train employees on this particular situation better. Other then that i usually have a easy going experience.

This grubbin joint never fails to fill that hunger craving. The best Kalbi Ribs in town and the Kalua Pig is pretty on point too. The best place to get a mid night snack, the service is always pleasant, and i always go back for more.

This place is great also. Same Chain!! Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is Great!! I love there garlic chicken BUT the only problem is they put TO MUCH GARLIC POWDER! At times you can see it. (gross)

The difference is this place is open later!! wooo hoooo..

Never been to the bar area tho..

The WORST customer service EVER! and here is why...

1) I was at Aloha kitchen with my friends, and was trying to pay for my own entree.  Their fugly manager was asking me to pay for EVERYONE! and of course I said no.  Why would I? I am not Santa Claus and It's not even Christmas yet.  
2) After I told her no I can't due to my financial hardship, she asked me to sell my bag that I was carrying with me.  (YOU DON'T FXXXING ASK YOUR CUSTOMER TO SELL THEIR BAG TO PAY FOR YOUR CHICKEN)
3) Then, in front of my boyfriend and everyone, that fugly manager asked me to switch a boyfriend that would pay for everyone, and laughed.  (I WAS LIKE, "WHY DON'T YOU JUST SERVE YOUR FOOD FOR FREE THEN, BITCH!) 
4) I told one of the guys that I will treat him a nice dinner next month because I am financially struggling these days.  And she told my friend to hang up on me if I ever call! (WHAT A BITCH!)

I have never written a review before and I never thought I would ever write a review as horrible as this one.  BUT what I am writing here is the truth, and the truth is powerful.  The personality of the  manager at ALOHA KITCHEN is as hideous as her appearance.  Even though I was extremely disappointed and angered by her HORRIBLE service, now I pity her because she is just OH SO!! hideous inside and out.  

SO!!! whenever any of you (who are reading this review) ever sees that fugly manager, you better be a BALLER and pay for EVERYONE you are with OR ELSE she will embarrass you to the MAX in front of everybody.

GREAT JOB to the MANAGER at ALOHA KITCHEN! I will definitely spread the "GOOD WORDS"  :D

Long story short, after a short discussion with an employee, who kept coming back and forth to my table while I was waiting for my food, she informed me that her manager said I was asked to leave because I couldn't provide proof or paperwork stating that the dog I had with me was, in fact, an actual service dog. Clearly the manager of this restaurant doesn't know that a service animal and their handler are protected against the Federal Law and that a person with a service dog may voluntarily present any proof but is NOT required to do so and you may not insist on proof or ask a person to leave because they could not, or would not, present any paperwork. In the end, they noticed, as I pointed out, the card on the dog's vest stating that law and she left. 2 stars because the food was good and the other cashier was friendly, but overall, very irritated that a manager doesn't know the laws and even I myself, who was once a manager elsewhere, knew that..

It's honestly embarrassing how much I eat here:) the food is seriously so bomb! It's so good. The teriyaki combo is what I always get. I do however love the mahi mahi. All the meat they use is fresh and quality. The macaroni is to die for. Not to mention the workers are so nice and friendly. And it's not expensive. Beware it's very addictive

It's Saturday night, the night before the Big Game. Our dear friend visiting from HI is in town for her birthday.  Her other friends are also visiting from HI and want to meet up.  This other group of friends are singers and they want to go to local bar for Karaoke.

So thirteen of us pile up in three cars and make our way to this Karaoke bar.  "Oh oh!" I think to myself.  "Why are there so many motorcycles?" We park our cars and make our way to the bar. As I walk past the motorcycles, they're big bikes but they're Yamahas and Hondas and not Harleys.  So I can calm down.  We get in and meet the rest of our party from HI.  They said the time they've been here, was on a week night. They just found out that Saturday nights is biker night! OMG!

So we're trying to figure out what we're going to do. So one of the girls texts her girlfriend and says Aloha Kitchen has Karaoke on Saturday night. This workout great as one of our party members was from Oregon and she wanted Hawaiian-style food anyway. 

Because we got to Aloha Kitchen a little late, all the booths for big parties were already taken. But the night of fun had already begun without us.

And I totally forgot that Aloha Kitchen's kitchen is open 24-hours. So we did it up HI style; ordered a couple of plates of fried noodles, manapuas, spam musubis, french fries, drinks and a couple of songs to sing.

4-stars for the Karaoke bar and 3.5-stars for the restaurant.

Very upset , Kalbi ribs are burnt and don't have a lot of meat on them . The Katsui meat was very thin and over cooked . Might as well eat beef jerky at this point . This for $10? Ive been here lots of times and today was just not acceptable , The food didnt taste good either .

Adobo fried rice omelet is a must try if you've never been. It's unique and can be a meal in and of itself. I like mine with a little gravy outside and in and egg yolk inside with hot sauce. I've been hooked on the  cut short ribs I can only seem to find back in Oceanside, CA at Guahan Grill, but their Kalbi short ribs are good too. The white rice on all their plates is good and consistent. The service could be better, but not indicative of rating. The cashier can get bogged down and the napkins are small and they never give enough. I need to come here in the winter as they have oxtail soup which is hard to find. Here is what a lot of people don't think about or know is that there is no hard breakfast or time to eat breakfast in the islands or in Vegas so getting their food at 3 because you didn't get to sleep until 9 am from partying all night long is not a shame, but probably the norm.

I love some of the dishes at Aloha Kitchen and decided to try the Banana Pancakes with Macadamia Nut Sauce and the Fried Rice Lovers Omelette. Ok the pancakes would've been delicious if two of the three weren't burnt. This was an order pickup so I didn't know until I got home and began eating them, very disappointed. The macadamia nut sauce is truly the star though. They actually ran out of macadamia nuts so that was already missing from the dish, didn't make a fuss about it. But these are pancakes and you know when they are burnt so they tucked the burnt ones under the one that wasn't. Would it had really been that hard to make two more, they don't take long to make and it wasn't that crowded. The Fried Rice Lovers Omelette was plentiful but super dry and bland, will never order it again. Extremely disappointed in my visit today!!!
Came back sober to make sure and the answer is yes the lumpia and teriyaki burger are both awesome sober and drunk

Came here because I raved about the food from other location near unlv... what a disappointment, brought some guest and was told kitchen was behind "about 20 minutes".  I ordered before my guest and they got their food way before me, not only was my food late but several other customers got their food before me. The guest I brought got their food and ate their food before I even got mine.  My friends adobo fried rice omelette was made spicy and never got sides.  I finally walked up to cashier and started pointing out that other parties got their food.  They still insisted mine was next.  Then I asked about the mac salad and spam musubis they still owed us.  How hard is it to scoop mac salad?  Funny thing is they had several mac salads on counter, none were mine.  Finally after 40+ minutes my food came, ox tail ramen and spam musubis... ramen noodles were hard, couldnt eat, had 4 pieces of ox tail only 1 had a good amount of meat.  Since I was last person to get my food, my guest were done eating... so I ate the ox tail, 1 musubi and didn't take the rest of ramen home.  One of the cashiers did try to give us old toron to apologise but that wasn't even good.

Never going back to this location.  If you want to try aloha kitchen, try the other locations before this one...

So I've never even seen this place before until I was invited to celebrate a birthday at happy hour with friends last night.  Whenever I'm going to a new place or restaurant I depend on my fellow yelpers to direct my path.  Will it suck or not?

I must say I truly enjoyed the happy hour at Aloha Kitchen & Bar.  First of all the drinks are nice and strong and cheap (even past happy hour).  The atmosphere is comfy cozy - just what I like.  At that nice early hour of the evening we had our pick of seating.  There are comfy couches as well.  You have to go and get your drink for the most part - but who cares?  The bar tender sometimes doubled as the karaoke technician - again who cares?  When I was ready for my Patron shot - he was there to pour it.  That's all that mattered.  Everyone here was very accommodating to our mildly-wild group.  There are plenty of karaoke books and selection - even rap if you wanna get jiggy with it - and the dance floor is spacious as well.  I like the outside smoking area that is gated in a bit but you still can sit there with your drink and your smoke and not miss a beat to the party.

Now the food!  Yum!!  That's right.  Yum!!! I had the Adobe Fried Rice Omelet, my daughter had the Teriyaki combo.  They were both phenomenal.  That Adobe Fried Rice is compact and delicious and full of goodness.  Check out the pics on Yelp!  It is the perfect meal after an evening of drinking!  Protein, carbs, meats - what's not to love?  I got it to go at the end of the evening and my intent was to save it for lunch at work the next day.  That poor yummy specimen barely made it to the next light!  

This is a nice chill place, very nice prices and fun atmosphere on both sides.  There is a door that separates the restaurant from the bar side.  And remember the bar is non-smoking so you have to go outside in the sitting area to do that.  You will have a good time!

Been living in Hawaii for the past 13 years and just moved to Vegas. The "garlic chicken" was just fried chicken breast with garlic powder poured on it. Went to use the bathroom and so far was the dirtiest bathroom I've been in since I moved here. Guess I'm gonna try and find a real Hawaiian place out here. I do no recommend.

Aloha Kitchen is an awesome place to try some awesome food. Their extended hours make it convenient for us night owls in the city. The staff is always awesome and the food is as well. It's only getting 4 stars, though, because I had gotten a bone in my teriyaki chicken the last time I went and it just creeped me out.

Don't even know what to say about this place. First off if they are going to serve Hawaiian food they can at least make it right.. Mahi Mahi wasn't Mahi Mahi at all. Teriyaki chicken was horrible and so was the garlic chicken. A family member got the kalua pig and cabbage said it wasn't bad. So far the worst Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas will not be returning. 
They also brib you to give them a good review on here in exchange for free egg rolls... 
P.s. I'm from hawaii I know how Hawaiian food is made and taste and this was not it at all. If you want some good Hawaiian food your better off going to L&L or so far the best I've been to is 808 Mix Plate

The heat while driving on westside of Vegas got me thirsty and starving for something similar to "home". Upon seeing the large sign from Sahara's roadway I decided to have an "Aloha" lunch.

I walked up to the order station. A menu with price listing was on a board above the order & cashier station. I ordered "Saimin Soup" , "Combination Bowl with Vegetables" and "Coconut Juice". I paid and was given a number tile with the number "15", to be called out for me to pick up my food order when it is ready. I chose to sit on a table under a "tiki" canopy overlooking the restaurant's wall of windows which brings in the day's sun. Nice, feeling like in the South Seas with colorful painting on its wall to add to the feeling.

Food was served on my table. My number was not called out. Great service!! Hot, steamy, yummy "Saimin Soup" was just right for my taste. I ordered it because I like soup and it had noodles. As it is my birthday, the long noodles stands for "long life". Mmmm, goood. The "Combination Bowl with Vegetables" was not ordinary with a special brown sauce over steamy white rice in a bowl. My Mom liked that, it was tasty. Our thirst was quenched by Coconut Juice on ice. Healthy and goood drink! 

The atmosphere is ambient in this Hawaiian & Filipino Restaurant serving both Hawaiian & Filipino favorites such as Pork Adobo, Kalua Pig & Cabbage served with macaroni salad & rice, Loco Moco, Chicken Curry, Hula/Hawaiian Plate, Tapsilog, Bento Box (of beef, teriyaki chicken, spam with pickled plum & furikake fish flakes), Kalbi Ribs, Mahi-Mahi dish, Lumpia Shanghai (my favorite) to name a few. Appetizers, Soups, Salads, Side Orders, Combination Plates, Specials, Sandwiches, Beverages, Breakfast & a Kids Meals are on the menu. One thing missing on the menu is Dessert. That's just fine with me as I was full from the meal. There is a Karaoke Bar in the Restaurant that opens in the evening through early morning. 

Enjoyed it, a good reasonably price meal for the day!

I've been coming to this place for as long as I can remember. Service has always been excellent, coming from the many faces I see come and go behind that counter, with the employees pretty much knowing my order as soon as I walk in. They also would deliver promptly whenever I would order for delivery. I've tried nearly everything on the menu, but the dish I ALWAYS order is the Local Plate. Which could very well be their signature dish since it's one of the most common items ordered from the menu. 

Everything from the macaroni salad, to the spam musubi is top notch...whenever it's cooked properly. You see, Over the past 8 or so years I've been coming here, the food has mostly been superb. But it's not very consistent. There have been quiet a few times where the Rice is either soggy or hard. Or the beef is too dry. It's a shame since whenever they do it right, it's FANTASTIC. But the few times they get it wrong, it's downright horrid. I can understand that not every single meal can be cooked perfectly, but the slip ups happen a bit too often. 

They do a good job of keeping the place clean too. It's visually appealing as well. There hasn't been a time where I was disgusted with the interior or even exterior of the restaurant. They also have a karaoke bar connected to the dining area, which is separated by its own set of doors.

This place will always be one of my favorite restaurants. Especially since the service is always excellent and the place is clean and eye catching. Overall, it's a great place to eat with good vibes all around. Just hope you catch the chef on a good day.
It is tradition that my friends and I visit Aloha Kitchen every trip to Vegas. I usually get their Moco Loco, Chicken Adobo Fried rice and Their Spam Masubi. We usually eat here late at night.

We love this place! Every Wednesday night after my Basketball game, my family and I always come here for dinner! I've been to many Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas and I can honestly say Aloha Kitchen is my favorite and has the best Kalbi Ribs in town!!!! I normally order their Portuguese Sausage breakfast meal cause I love breakfast and they have the best in town with that meal as well! My wife and son love their Miso soup and their Spam Musubi is on point! Regardless what you order, you have to get a side of Kalbi Ribs! I can make poetry about those Ribs lol...

Well what can i say ... today's visit was the last straw!  How does a restaurant RUN OUT OF TOILET PAPER??!!!  Yes, run out of toilet paper in the only working bathroom, the other bathroom has an out of order sign on the door!  I ask the girl for toilet paper & she hands me a paper towel roll.  So i say, "this isn't toilet paper" to which she responds, "yeah, we're out of toilet paper".  I was actually at a loss for words!  What?  You can't have someone run down to the store for toilet paper?!  This place has been steadily going down.

I've eaten here numerous times & my experience has always been the same:
Food is good, prices are reasonable, and depending on the dish, servings are either sufficient or a lot! So, you can't go wrong there!

If you're a newbie, it can be a little confusing whether you need to tip at the table or not. You order at the counter, you get your own drinks, they serve your dish at the table, and they clean up the table when you're done. I typically tip, but others could differ.

Tried this place when I was in Las Vegas, and they have awesome food.  Their Kalua pig, and oxtail soup are awesome!! Very reasonable priced!  When in Vegas eat off the Strip, you get better food , at a far better value!  Will definately be back next time I am in Vegas!

The food at this Hawaiian Restaurant is sooo good! I love how they offer a wide selection..from Hawaiian, Filipino and Korean! I ordered the beef kalbi and my husband ordered the chicken katsu. We also ordered the lumpia as our side dish. The beef kalbi and the chicken katsu are both delish! But the Lumpia was just like a wonton wrapper and 1/2 pork on it. It was good food with reasonable cost. 
I'm giving this restaurant three stars because of their bad service. My husband asked the lady behind the counter 3 spoons but the lady just gave her one. Then he asked for a highchair and she just pointed to it like there it is go get it type of an attitude. Lastly when we asked for hand soap in the bathroom as the container was  empty it took them a while to get back to us. 
I would definitely come back for the great food but next time I will just take it home with me to avoid all the hassles.
Always eat here with friends. Amazing atmosphere, really cool service. Will never stop coming here. Lol whether it's really late at night, they still there to make you some food. Lol

In Vegas there is a lot of chocies for Hawaiian/Filipino food. This place has been around for awhile and is still one of my favorites. My usual here is the "adobod fried rice omelette" its super tasty!! Their chicken katsu is tasty as well. Ive tried other items on their menu and haven't been disappointed. If your in the mood for this kind of food and near one of their locations give it a try. You'll definitely find something on their menu you'll like.

The flavor alone makes this place worthy of five stars. I've tried different dishes and each time I've been amazed at how tasty the food is. I had the Kalua pig and Katsu combo. Katsu was soooo good (first time eating it there). Kalua pig was good as usual. 

Spam musubi never disappoints.

First time ordering kimchi too. The difference in taste/texture complemented the food in such a weird way but it was yummy. Definitely adding kimchi to my order again.  

First time ordering the miso soup too. I was a little hesitant with it cuz some places just use the powder and you can taste the blandness, but the flavor in this one was soooooo good. If I hantavirus ordered so much I would have downed the whole thing in a heartbeat!

The fact that they're open almost 24hrs makes it more than just a reliable after-club hotspot, but more a requirement when going to Las Vegas.

Aloha Kitchen on Decatur is a godsend if you are visiting Vegas and craving some good, cheap Hawaiian or Filipino food and can make the 5-10 minute drive off the strip (this is also a good time to make a snack/water/drink/booze run at a local grocery).

This review is all about one item which has become legendary amongst my circle of friends.  The Adobo Fried Rice Omelet.  It's a pretty simple concept: shredded chicken adobo and fried rice (that looks as if it was fired in the adobo sauce itself) are wrapped in a thin layer of scrambled egg.  The result is a burrito-sized omelet of adobo goodness!  The fried rice is always nice and moist and the chicken is just the same.  The flavors of the adobo sauce are immediately evident, the savory soy sauce, tangy vinegar and the garlic are present in every bite, with the egg adding an additional texture to contrast the rice and chicken.  Oh, and this thing is BIG.  I don't think I've ever eaten a whole omelet in one sitting.  I usually save half for later or share with a friend.  I imagine I could defeat the beast if I focused on it, but I'm usually too hungover or too concerned about the buffet that is to follow later in the day to ever attempt the feat.

If you like adobo, you need to try the adobo fried rice omelet!

For those unfamiliar with Filipino-style adobo:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adobo#Filipino_adobo

I've also sampled the lumpia (think Filipino-style eggrolls) and the turon (dessert lumpia with banana and jackfruit) and liked them both, but our motto in Vegas has become "eyes on the prize!"  All we get now is the omelet.

Food is good, service is good. But policy, sucks. This is the first place that I've been to that requires a matching identification for a debit transaction. So that means if you have a significant other that is sick at home and you use her card to go out and buy food, I don't recommend thus place. I would highly recommend aloha specialty located in the California Hotel and casino. The food is just as good and they do both debit and credit transactions.

Since everyone and their mothers on here mentions the Adobo Fried Rice omelette, a few friends of mine decided to go down here after coming back from the club to see what the hype was about.  I liked that it was open till 5am, the cashier was polite, and it was relatively cheap.  

The adobo omelette itself was a bit salty but decent.  I was expecting greatness but didn't really experience it w/ this.  Perhaps the eggs and the adobo together just wasn't working for me, but I will give them a plus on portion size.  The damn thing was the size of an extra large burrito that you'd find at a Mexican restaurant.  

Overall it's definitely a place worth trying.  If you're staying on the strip and looking for some Hawaiian / Filipino food to grub on it's about 5 miles and a $21 cab ride away, so go with friends.  Who knows, you might like it.

This is a nice little place with some good food.  I'm not a huge fan of Hawaiian food, mostly because I hate pineapple with a passion, but a friend of ours wanted to go sing karaoke, so we tried it out.

This place is a restaurant with a karaoke bar next door.  At the bar, the drinks are about $5 - $6, but I have to say they're pretty weak.  I got the feeling that you don't really go to the bar to drink, you go more to watch the karaoke singers.  I myself am too chicken to get up there and sing, but more power to the people who do!  One of the people I came with said, "There are three types of karaoke singers: ones who are really good, ones who think they're good but are really bad, and ones who know they're bad and don't give an *ish* because they're having fun."  I definitely saw all three types that night.  Oh, and a guy who looked like Michael Jackson and Prince combined...he sang "Music of the Night"...both the Christine and Raul parts...it was amazing.

You can order food and they will bring it to you in the bar, too, which is pretty cool.  I had the garlic chicken which totally lived up to it's name and thank God had no pineapple anywhere near it, and was sooooo tender I just shredded it off with a fork.  My husband ordered the adobo fried rice and loved it.

I may be a Hawaiian food convert after coming to this place (just so long as there is no VILE FRUIT in it) and would like to experience the karaoke again.

This place is just like the 3 stars says: A-OK.
Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is awesommmmmeee
Haven't eaten here in a few months. Happy I chose it for lunch today. It was delish. Thank you Aloha for a great lunch.

For my Hawaiian fix, this is my spot. Fast, friendly service.  I usually get the fried saimin and add spam to it. yum. This visit I went with chicken katsu. For around $8 you get 2 chicken breast! Rice and mac salad. My boyfriend got the kalbi.  For dine in, they offer tent service.  They give you an order number then they deliver food to your table. Attached to the restaurant is a bar with karaoke, fun stuff. I like aloha kitchen way more than L&L.  Also the place is clean and they turn tables pretty quick when it is busy. Aloha!!! :-)

Closest place in Vegas that I have tried that comes close to the islands Ono taste & cooking! I've tried basically all the Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas, but the cooking here comes close to home and I love it!

Worst service I have ever seen. We placed our order and they only gave us cups for two of our five drinks. When I pressed them on this, they gave us the five we were supposed to get. 

After about 10 minutes or so, the waiter brought out our two orders of Loco Moco. Another 7 minutes after that they brought out our three kids meals. Another 5 minutes they brought another one of our entrées (which was not correct) and our Ahi Poke appetizer. 

Seriously, appetizer 23ish minutes and after other food??

After sitting for another 15 minutes, they brought out our final entree. Long after everybody else was finished eating.

We were also led to believe there was family friendly karaoke here. There is not. Karaoke is in a separate non family friendly bar area.

We will not be back to this place.

My husband and I ate here on our Vegas vacation recently and loved this place. It's in a rather old, smoky casino hotel called The California, and not to be missed if you love a good Vegas bargain and Hawaiian food plates. We ordered some Spam Musubi to try, which is pretty much Spam sushi with the seaweed rolled on the outside. Unusual and delicious! Not to mention cheap. I ordered the Teriyaki Hamburger Steak, which comes with the prerequisite rice and creamy macaroni salad. It was really good, with brown gravy and onions but reminded me more of Salisbury steak than a teriyaki dish. The portions at this place are huge too! I couldn't finish mine. My husband could, but he's an Italian guy who can eat. My husband got the Teriyaki Chicken and let me try it. Friends, this is how teriyaki should taste. Grilled and tender, with a flavorful teriyaki sauce that tastes fresh made and not from a bottle. They have the best hot green tea, too. It was a roasted green tea, and I loved it so much I hunted it down at an Asian supermarket in Vegas before we left. It's called YamaMotoYama Hoji-cha Roasted Green Tea and it's delicious. Didn't have any room for dessert, though. Very friendly staff there. You order and pay at the cash register and they bring it to you. Decor was delightful yet understated Hawaiian/Asian. Prices are unbelievable, especially with the quality of food and the portions - our dinner plates were $8 or less. Enjoyed it immensely!

My review is for the restaurant side only.  The bar side stinks.

The chicken teriyaki and loco moco are outstanding.
I had such a good time here. The food was good with big portions. The kareoke dj did a great job keeping the crowd Laughing and having fun. My friends and I will be back for more.

I have to say I had great expectations when I got here because a few people had raved about it. Although the prices are pretty good some of the dishes lacked the flavor I was hoping for. Now its very hard to replicate flavors of things you have had . Now don't get me wrong there food was decent but I've  been to Hawaii and I have had plenty of the same dishes this place serves up. I will definitely give them  credit for effort on certain dishes. Let me start by saying Banana Mac nut pancakes are pretty good. The Korean BBQ was good it had nice flavors and a pretty good serving . Now the Tapa wasn't all that great they use a thinly slice meat like you would use for cheesesteaks and flavor wise there wasn't any. The Spam musubi had way too much rice and also lacked that extra sauce on the rice to give it that extra punch.  The Macaroni salad was missing something I fell flat on flavor( maybe it was the Mayo). I would come back but maybe try something else.
This location is much nicer than the one on the east side. Decent fining room. Food is always good.

I really enjoy Aloha Kitchen.

Whenever I'm in the area I try to stop in.

On my last visit I ordered the Kalbi Combo. Which comes with the kalbi short ribs, teriyaki chicken and chicken katsu, rice and macaroni salad.

Now I've tried their katsu several times and I don't really like it so I swap my katsu for teriyaki everytime.

The short ribs are a little pricey if you order an entire dinner of them, so I order this combo so I at least get a taste of them without breaking the bank, but it always leaves me desiring more.

This and the actual wait times that it takes to get your food sometimes is why I ranked them 4 stars instead of 5.

I have been coming here for years and as soon as I walk in they know what imma order.  To sweeten things up they always double the portion of what I order.

The Bar happy Hours from 12pm-6pm is a local secret lol.  When Im in the mood to drink real early, this is the spot!!  2 dollar shots and 3 dollar beers cant beat that!!!

Pretty bomb Hawaiian food! Esp the spam masubis, definitely a killer. Their fried rice wrapped in omelet is super bomb as well, it's just a little bit too salty for me (personal preference) everything else was pretty bomb too and not too expensive
*Saturday March 29, 2014....Aina Roots Birthday Bash with Live Performances by Bengali x Las Vegas Reggae AllStars Ft.Ryan & Iz frm HaleAmanO x Aina Roots...No Cover Charge....Doors 9pm...21+

Ono food!!

Coming from Hawaii to the mainland, its hard to find good, authentic Hawaiian food. I've been going here for YEARS and the food has always been the same every time, DELICIOUS!! A lot of the time I get Lau Lau and its always cooked perfectly. The pork in it is always so moist and there's lots of taro leaves to eat. This is the only place in town I'll get my Lau Lau from, other places are too dry.

Just recently I the adobo omelet and MAN! So good!

The customer service is excellent and they're always really friendly.

I love this place and will continue to go back again and again.

Aloha Kitchen & Bar was a great experience for my husband and I! The waitress was welcoming and helpful when we had trouble deciding on ordering. My husband ordered the loco moco while I ordered the adobo omelete and we both ordered a spam musubi. Both dishes were bursting with flavor; the gravy, the burger patty, mixed well with the rice and my adobo had a great balance of vinegar and seasoning. We will be visiting again soon!

I've eaten here 5 times. There's only a couple things on the menu that actually tastes good. I'm from Hawaii... I ate a lot of good food. The cashier rushes you... I have 3 people w me, after I order he's like "is that it?" No, my son orders... "it's that it?" No! My wife orders, "is that it?" Like wtf! I'll tell you when that's it! I ordered a teriyaki burger and he asks how I want it done, I'm like...There's only one way to cook a hamburger patty right? He says no, you can have it rare, medium rare, medium well or well done. Geez I didn't order a rib eye steak. So I get the teri-burger and there's cheese on it! Who does that!? Never in my life ordering probably 300 teri burgers from when I was a lil kid have I seen cheese on a teri burger...tasted like crap and the patty was pre-made frozen...nasty. Only reason I put 2 stars is the won ton soup is good. This is my opinion

The food is amazing here :) I always have a great time time at the karaoke bar area.

My top 3 dishes you must try 
-Adobo Omelette
-Local Plate
-Kula Pig and Cabbage  

Proud sponsor of pLaYhOuSe basketball
Love this place. Eat here 2 to 3 times a week.. Chicken fried rice omelette is my favorite.
No trip to Vegas is ever complete without a visit from this place. Either its the first or last stop of your trip, you just have to, HAVE TO, drop by and get a taste of their Adobo Burrito.. YUMMY!

I'm a sucker for Hawaiian food, and the student special is by far one of the best values. The way the chicken is prepared makes it so delicious compared to other Hawaiian style Teri chicken. I simply can't get enough of it! I do despise the price of the musubi, at $2.50 a pop it's kind of ridiculous! Other than that the staff is always friendly and inviting. Food is prepared fast, but be weary of coming late at night. For some reason during night hours the rice seems like it's been sitting forever and is all mushy and disgusting. Great place for lunch and right down the street from my work!

After watching a show in Vegas, we were hungry and wanted some soup. It was freezing outside and I remembered seeing The Aloha Kitchen sign traveling down Decatur. My friend's from Oahu and she said her friend told her about Aloha Kitchen and to give it a try. So after the show I yelped them and the pictures all looked so good and the best part of it all..... they close at 5:00AM! I was craving Ox Tail soup too so F it.. we're going. I was a bit bummed that the Ox Tail soup was not on their menu so oh well... i'll just get the Loco Moco. But while standing in line and look what I see..... A printed out sign. OX TAIL SOUP Special !!!! Mahalo!!  
It hit the spot for real! My wife had the Spam Musubi and she said it was pretty good. There was a Karaoke bar next door but we didn't venture in there.
Food is good but can't get a order right . They Forgot two things that come with the meal . Smh

Aloha/Kumusta ka! This is a Hawaiian and Filipino restaurant in one.

The Food: I've only been here once and I ordered the Adobo Omelette (Pork). And it was very, very good. The portion size was good for 2; or one huge hawaiian. I also, had the Spam Musubi. Also good but nothing out of the ordinary.

The place: Medium-size restaurant. Had plenty of people during lunch time (at least when I was there). The place was clean for eating.

Parking: Restaurant located at a shopping mall so there's plenty of parking spots.

The bad: I didn't see any dessert on their menu.

Overall: Go and try the Adobo Omelette; you'll be stuffed and satisfied. Not sure how authentic the food are, but it's good and that's all that really matters.

Aloha Kitchen = best hangover cure after a crazy night in Vegas!

Order the adobo omelet - it's amazingly delicious. I also got to taste the adobo and katsu combo plate, which was pretty good too. However, I would stick with the adobo omelet for yummy stick-to-your-ribs grub.

I recommend that this place spice up their macaroni salad that comes on the side with their combo plates. It tasted a bit bland and I could only eat a bite of it.

food is good, i like their siamin soup...i wish their kalbi wasn't so fatty though. 

i think their prices are a little too much for the quality of their food though and one thing i hate is when they give me so little napkins, i mean i get it, some people are so dunb they waste a fckn shitload of napkins and i do hate that...but if i order kalbi and will be using my hands, i expect to have at least a few napkins!!!

overall, my and my friends used to go here alot, its a clean place and the decor is cool.

We always stop by the other location when passing through Vegas to get the adobo omelette. The kids love the katsu and this time I tried the Ox tail soup as well. Foods good, fast, and inexpensive compared to everything else in the area. Service is always friendly.

I've been coming here faithfully for years now.  They're open really late which fits my schedule nicely.  

There's a bar where they do karaoke and when that door opens you can easily have that music blasting inside the restaurant.  Horrible singers too, psssh I could be worse.  The staff is nice and friendly but the cashier or helper in the back has to be responsible also to clean up the tables so they sometimes miss a spot or two just so they can get back to the register.  

But the benefactor that bumps this up to 4 stars over an average three is the flexible hours for some of us drunks tha need Hawaiian prepared food after midnight!

3 1/2 stars for sure.  Me, I'm local boy living in Vegas since my UNLV days.  And I always crave for food from back home.  If it comes with 2 scoops calrose rice (not this Uncle Ben stuff), and 1 scoop mac salad I give it a go!  I haven't been here in a while so I'm gonna leave the prices out on this one.  Sorry Hawaiians!

Food at Aloha Kitchen is pretty good, think of it as Hawaiian fast food if you will.  Not the healthiest of menus, but in a crave this place definitely fills a need.  I hope you aren't cutting carbs on this day!  The menu is a mix of Hawaiian, Filipino, Chinese, Japanese, Korean all rolled into one.  Just like the people of Hawaii!  Chop Suey kine!  Popular are the Chicken Katsu and the Kalua Pig plates, big buggah servings with lots of rice and mac salad!  I like the Teriyaki combo with teriyaki chicken, pork, and beef, and I like the Kalbi combo too with Kalbi ribs, chicken katsu, and teriyaki chicken.  So ono!  

The menu is pretty big, there's apps like manapua, egg rolls, shumai, chicken wings, and poke.  Of course there's saimin, and wonton soup, as well as cheeseburgers, teriyaki burgers, and a mahi mahi sandwich as well.  And we can't forget the locals' fav...Spam Musubi!  There's is very good, I usually order 2-one for me and one to share (sharing optional).  There's lots of daily favorites like their teriyaki bowls, fried saimin, Loco Moco (yum), curry, Lau Lau (more yum), tempura, beef stew, and garlic chicken w/gravy just to name a few!

My biggest vice here though?  The Adobo Fried Rice Omelette.  This thing rocks!  I get it everytime I go!  Pork adobo fried with rice and lots of garlic, and put into an omelette.  I would have this thing for breakfast if I didn't for lunch!  I love mine with ketchup and shoyu on top...with a Spam Musubi (or 2)...and a side of kim chee.  Brok' da mouth!  Comfort food for me at it's finest.

Now don't go here expecting gourmet anything, your food will not be served on fine China or be expertly presented.  What you got here is some good no frills eats!  When you hungry this place will do on a budget.  Oh and don't forget the Aloha Bar right next door!  Karaoke contests and cheap drinks galore just about every week.  Although the last time I ate Aloha Kitchen sounded like cats were screaming Aerosmith's 'I Don't Wanna Miss A Thing' next door.  Meow!

Kalua pork, lumpia, spam musubi, tapsilog, katsu, saimin soup, loco moco,  chicken adobo fried rice omelette--available late at night after the club!!! Yup, I did say "chicken adobo fried rice omelette"! Need I say more? This place is the spot to satisfy your Hawaiian lunch plate w/ Filipino and Japanese flare craving at any time of the day! They have three convenient location in Las Vegas. Onoliciously masarap!!!

Although there's other Aloha Kitchens out here, this is one to go to. 

In regards to taste (my opinion):
1.  Katsu: not the best in town. BTW, look up Katsu on urban dictionary.
2.  Spam Masubi: Okay, sometimes too loose.
3.  Loco Moco: I recommend 
4.  Fried Rice Adobo Omelette: The best!!!

If you're looking for Hawaiian food and want have fun at the same time, come here Friday nights. Can get crowded and tough to find a seat though. 

I've also learned not to wear all black and stand outside when I'm here. At least 3 times, people thought I was a bouncer. I even joked with someone and almost got a cover charge from them.

I make my pilgrimage to AK whenever I'm in Sin City and when I can't, I still think about it. I love the down home feeling I get when I'm there. Most of the stuff on the menu I can probably make at home  (and I can save myself the future medical bills) but oh heck, why not indulge in some thick, cholesterol laden gravy?! 

My BMF, Malino has been a Las Vegas local for the past 6 years and I'm sure he's had enough of AK but as long as he knows that a trip to AK will make me smile and his BMF position stays in tact, he will gladly take me there.

Staffs are nice! Good foods. 
They ask for ID when you pay with card and they have atm if you forgot your id.

If you are In the mood for Hawaiian then this place is pretty good. To be honest the only reason I continue to come back is because my girlfriend really likes it. The staff is not very friendly and the decor is horribly outdated. The spam musubi is the best thing on the menu.

I was not trying to eat here, but ended up at this place by accident.  Since Google is not a great indicator when places go belly up and my original destination was the now defunct Red Robins in the same parking area this was a " what the hell, I'm hungry" kind of place.  Loved it!!!  They had a little bit of everything.  I went for the teriyaki plate and some lumpia.  I could have done without the skin on the chicken but loved the lumpia.  It was so mild, and I didn't get a bit of heartburn.  If they had an Aloha Kitchen anywhere near where I lived I would have a new favorite.

This place sets the bar for fast Hawaiian bbq. Everything I have tried has been good to excellent. I love their mac salad and chicken teryaki, its the best at any Hawaiian bbq places I have tried. 

Note: they offer call ahead take out orders which is fantastic for busy professionals.

haven't seen a Hawaiian BBQ place that has adobo on their menu too! I wasn't too hungry but had a craving for shanghai lumpia $2.99 which hit the spot and ordered spam musubi $1.99 don't really know anywhere else to get lumpia without being invited to some family party, this will do until then, **4 stars for now because is there anyway you can possibly mess up shanghai lumpia or spam musubi? May change once I try the adobo fried rice omelette

**update: ordered the adobo fried rice omelette, didn't know what to expect, but imagine a thin omelette burrito stuffed with a fried rice/ adobo mixture.  The portion was huge but a little on the dry side, I had to add soy sauce/siracha to juice it up.  Otherwise, okay, not what I expected, it's basically fried rice and adobo with scrambled eggs.

Service is crap!!  I ordered teriyaki chicken and they charged me .27 cents for teriyaki sauce.  I mean really??  With the nickel and dime crap.  This alone will never make me spend my money here again.  First and last time customer!

I used to always hit up this spot late night because of their hours. It was decent enough to come back each time, but if there were other spots open later, I would definitely go to other spots. I almost always order their local plate, which is beef and chicken teriyaki and 2 spam musubis, and I substitute the rice for veggies because I don't like all those carbs, and I also substitute the macaroni salad for kim chi. I have tried plenty of this other dishes as well, but my favorite thing about their menu is the kim chi, which I'm sure says a lot. It's just an average meal, hence the 3 stars. 

However, the last time we did end up going here, my boyfriend had food poisoning from their curry. And now he won't ever return here, which, I guess isn't too much of a loss..

This is the place to go for reasonably priced Hawaiian food when in Vegas.  Now this isn't any place fancy, no fusion happening here, just good Hawaiian food with people that are there for the same reason, to grab!

There is another side to the restaurant, the bar area.  Haven't been to that side but I've always wanted to walk in to enjoy drink and the music...

It's a small place of the strip, but there are always Polynesian, Hawaiian, Somoa, etc. there and my hubby feels like he's home again.  They're never empty and there times they are absolutely full, no seats available.  Either way, he looks like he belongs there.

Food was to go this night, but the service was great and as always the ladies there make you feel like you're family as they talk and joke with you.  

Come and try the macadamia pancakes or the Loco Moco.  The katsu here is pretty good too.

I had one of the worst experiences I've ever had at a restaurant tonight at aloha kitchen. Multiple members of the staff were extremely rude, and argumentative. I has born and raised in Hawaii, and for a place to call themselves "aloha kitchen" it would be nice if you were serve your food with aloha instead of attitude. Horrible service!!! Not coming back, and I would suggest that everyone else find a different spot as well.

Good grubbing of the island kine.

We had a quick breakfast pick up here during a recent visit in Vegas with friends and ordered up a lot of food.

Breakfast spread http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aloha-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=_A6eqibhsvixKCuL55KR6g#zJ1UnVQ_qWLwg_wxRC-UXA  We got the basics Portugese sausage and eggs, lots of Spam musubi!  You cant go to a place called aloha kitchen and not get musubi's!  These were of good size and a nice thick cut of spam unlike same places there the ratio is more rice than spam.

Adobo fried rice http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aloha-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=_A6eqibhsvixKCuL55KR6g#7HB73c6cPjKml2mVyEt2kw  This was a pretty tasty omelette with lots of adobo inside.  Def a must get!

I didn't actually go to pick up the order so I cant speak to how the place is.

Eyes ~ Wow that is a spread!
Nose ~ Smells Yum!.
Ear ~ Everyone happy with the food.
Mouth ~ These are all pretty ono!.
Tummy ~ Full and ready for the day!

Yum! This place was great quality food at an affordable price. I don't mind paying the price for good food, but it better be good. 
I had the spam musubi. Fresh seaweed and moist rice. Kids chicken teriyaki plate was good to. Portions were generous. Great fast food style hawaiian food in Vegas.
